loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 42, lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Lydia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang est une commerçante, elle s'active dans ce secteur depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle habite dans une ville située à l'ouest du Sénégal. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le but de s'approvisionner en marchandises comme des fruits de mer (pagnes, crevettes, crabes) dans la petite côte qu'elle va revendre dans sa ville tout cela pour avoir une pour feuille qui lui permettra d'être autonome financièrement et de répondre aux besoins de sa familles
texts.en:
Mbayang is a retailer. She has been invovled in this line of work for more than 20 years. 

She lives in a town in the western part of Senegal. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy merchandise such as seafood (ark clams, shrimp, crab) on the coast for re-sale in her town. Her goal is to have enough money to be financially self-sufficient and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to by merchandise.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba. 

Leonarda tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urcos y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Leonarda es la venta de comida en el mercado. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y bidones de aceite. 

Leonarda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the "New Hope of Ollantaytambo" communal bank. The members meet every thirty days in the city of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba.

Leonarda is 37 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has three children. She was born in the city of Urcos, and she lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she works. Leonarda's main work is selling food in the market. She has already been doing this for 12 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her job.

This time Leonarda needs the loan to purchase more supplies, for example, bags of rice and sugar and bottles of oil.

Leonarda is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, for example, bags of rice and sugar and bottles of oil

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a farmer. He is married and he lives with his family. He has been growing corn for several years. He learned to do this from his father. This work makes Felix very happy. Due to his experience, he is able to do many farm processes perfectly.

Now he needs to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to start the process of planting corn. The purchase of these materials will be a great help for Felix. 

His dream is to one day have his own home and build a house.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib operates a restaurant and carpentry business in Masindi-Uganda. He is aged 51 and married with four children. Fluctuating prices due to the current inflation is his major challenge and his dream is a hotel in the city. He desires to educate his children, and expand business. Habib wants a loan to buy food for his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food for his restaurant.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 20 year old single woman with no children. She has had a business selling green vegetables in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Juan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase green vegetables. She will use her extra income to pay her school fees

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 37-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Maria Theresa has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy clothing to sell.

Maria Theresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Абдусамад предоставляет услугу, он в основном занимается развозкой пассажиров. В этой области Абдусамад имеет богатый опыт. Он берет кредит для ремонта своей машины.
texts.en: Abdusamad lives in the Khujand region. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. Abdusamad works in the service sector, he is a taxi driver. He has a loat of experience driving passengers. Abdusamad needs this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Luz Elena De Fatima

texts.es: A sus 61 años, la señora Luz Elena se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir a terceros, su experiencia es de más de 35 años en este sector e inicia su propio taller gracias a su padre quién le obsequió su primera máquina de confección. Actualmente, la señora Luz Elena desea sacar su propia línea de pijamas y seguir apoyando económicamente para los gastos de la vivienda y el estudio del último de sus 3 hijos; para lo cual necesita de la compra de insumos de telas e hilos para iniciar su nueva línea con la cual sueña poder incrementar su clientela, posicionar su marca y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
61 years old, Luz Elena makes a living creating garments of clothing for third parties. She has more than 35 years of experience in this business and opened her own shop thanks to her father, who gave her her first sewing machine. 

Right now, Luz Elena wants to start her own line of pajamas and continue helping financially with the costs of living and the schooling of the youngest of her three children. She needs to purchase supplies like fabric and thread to begin her new line, with which she hopes to be able to increase her customer base, create her brand, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years old, married and has three children.  He has been farming for over ten years and has employed two people.  He has grown his business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills.

George hopes to expand his business for more income generation in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has three children.  He has been operating a retail shop for twelve years. He also does farming for extra income generation.

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business because he has been trained on business management.  He hopes to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 45,000 to buy beans, maize, oil, sugar and soaps.

loans.use: buy beans, maize, oil, sugar and soaps.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Es un joven trabajador de 20 años de edad, pertenece a etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su esposa trabaja de manera informal, como ayudanta en un tramo de ropa usada. Él trabaja en una empresa de marisco. Solicita su primer crédito para construir poco a poco su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y postes, con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento, ya que actualmente habita en casa de familiares y es compartida por 8 personas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casita de madera.

loans.use: para construir poco a poco su vivienda de tambo y madera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to pay school fees

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta has been running her restaurant for the past five years catering to Yazaki Eds Samoa employees. The restaurant caters snacks, Chinese cakes, and other affordable snacks which are all produced and cooked by Eseta. Eseta’s restaurant is likely to succeed because she is catering to one of the biggest companies with the highest number of employees. She also knows what her customers want and can afford which is one of the reasons why it is expanding. Eseta also caters to local schools. It is her enthusiasm, hard work, and dedication into reaching her dream that has taken her this far to five years in the restaurant business.

loans.use: finance equipment to further expand the Food Stall

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
Ms Maria del Socorro is a widow of eleven years. She has worked every day to motivate her seven children, five of which are in school. She started cleaning houses for an income that would allow her to support her family. Then she started studying cosmetology, and, with great effort, after eight years was able to open her own beauty salon where she works arduously so that her children have the ability to finish school.

Maria is a very responsible and hard-working person. She wants her business to grow, and therefore requests a loan of $275 dollars to invest in the purchase of a washing basin to wash hair. With this, she can improve her service to her customers. Maria’s family appreciates your generosity and support in the growth of this business and betterment of this family’s way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace once años que la señora Maria del Socorro es viuda, y desde entonces se esfuerza día a día por sacar adelante a sus siete hijos, cinco de ellos estaban estudiando en aquel momento. Empezó haciendo las labores domésticas en algunas casas para obtener el ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su familia, después comenzó a estudiar belleza y, con mucho esfuerzo, desde hace ocho años pudo abrir su estética donde trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios.

Maria es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, quiere ver crecer su negocio, para esto necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compara de un lavabo para lavar el cabello, con esto podrá mejorar el servicio que otorga a sus clientes. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase a hair washing basin

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina N. is a single Muganda lady by tribe and an artist by profession. She joined Life in Africa in 2004 together with other artists. When she joined, life was hard, and she did not have a job. She is very active in doing things and is a good leader. During her reign as Talent Discovery Team Leader, everybody was pleased. Serina is fond of children and of saving. She even was a champion of the Life in Africa member saving program. As a contribution to the community, she spent some of her own money to help get musical instruments like long drums, etc.

Being good at crafts and even more so at knitting, Serina has opened a boutique in Kiwatule where she sells her products alongside soda and beer for wholesale. This business is doing well. For her boutique, she now needs more materials as she has received a bulk order to be finished by August 4, 2007. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 (250,000 Uganda shillings) and is sure she can repay it in a timely fashion.

Below is Serina's budget:

12 pieces of cloth @ 20,000/=………………240,000/=

Transport ………… …………………………10,000/=

Total ………………………………………….250,000/=

loans.use: Buying cloth for her little boutique

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. deals in tomatoes & fruit in an open-market in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to buy more tomatoes and also fruit  for the expansion of her business. Mary is married, mother of 4 children, and has been a LAPO client for 5 years. She has a total of 11 years' experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes & fruits for resale

loans.name: Juana Agripina

texts.es:
Juana and Eduardo formed their household with dreams of living in an atmosphere of warmth, harmony, and familial love. The fruit of this dream and their immense love was the birth of six children. Everything was going well in the home until tragedy struck. Eduardo was heartlessly murdered by a band of rustlers (animal thieves) in front of his entire family, an event that has scarred their lives and been terribly difficult to overcome.

With the pain and fragility of their small children, Juana had to work hard at many different jobs, always accompanied by her little ones to earn a daily income. Thanks to her arduous work and dedication, she was able to save enough to buy a pair of cows, and by selling the milk she achieved a certain economic stability and improved her family’s quality of life. Now, many years later, she and her older daughters wish to grow their business of selling milk. They are requesting a financial loan that will allow them to increase their capital and acquire more cows. She is committed to repaying the loan in six months. This spirited family anxiously awaits your rapid response.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juana y Eduardo formaron su hogar con muchas ilusiones de vivir en un ambiente cálido y sobre todo en armonía y unión familiar, fruto de esa concepción y el inmenso amor que se profesan nacieron seis hijos y cuando todo marchaba muy bien en su hogar de pronto se presentó una tragedia, Eduardo fue asesinado por una turba de abigeos (ladrones de animales) en presencia de toda su familia sin ninguna compasión, hecho que les marcó la vida y fue muy difícil de superar.Con la pena y fragilidad de sus pequeños niños Juana tuvo que trabajar arduamente en diferentes oficios eventuales siempre acompañado de sus pequeños para generar el sustento diario, gracias a su ardua tarea y dedicación pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un para de vaquitas y con la comercialización de la leche que obtenía de ellas logró cierta estabilidad económica e incrementó la calidad de vida de su familia.Ahora, después de muchos años, junto a sus hijos ya mayores desea seguir acrecentando su negocio de venta de leche y para esto está solicitando un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá aumentar su capital y adquirir más animales (vacas); ella promete retornarles el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.“Esta familia luchadora espera ansiosamente tu pronta respuesta”

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
As you can see from the picture, the windows of my house are quite unsafe; you can easily remove them with a simple thump. I would like to install safety bars on all my windows so that I may give my family more security. I am requesting $250.00 to be able to carry out this project.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Como pueden ver en la foto las ventanas de mi casa son muy inseguras ya que con un simple golpe las puedes quitar, me gustaría poner rejas en todas las ventanas para poder darle a mi familia más seguridad” Solicito $ 250.00 dlls para poner rejas en las ventana de mi vivienda

loans.use: Installation of window safety bars for my home

loans.name: Morries I Group

texts.en:
Enid is 32 years old and married with five children of ages 15, 13, 7, 5 and 10 months.
She plans to buy more products for her store.
With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rocio's Group

texts.en:
Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam have been part of the community bank “Magnolia” for eight months, three years, and one year respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual, develop their business, and to avoid sickness. They mentioned that they like the solidarity they find in the community bank.

Marivel is 24 years old. She is a single mother and has a nine-year-old daughter. Marivel sells “raspadillas” which are similar to snow cones. She has had a stand in the “Americas Market”, for one year. In addition, in her free time Marivel does laundry.

Rocio is 34 years old. She lives with her partner and twelve year old son. For years Rocio has been selling cosmetics products to her friends and family. She also sells clothing to friends and businesses.

Miriam is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and six year old daughter. Miriam travels to the jungle eight hours from Ayacucho and sells potatoes, and grains. There she buys fruits, which she sells in Ayacucho.

Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam need loans of 200, 600, and 600 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying clothing, potatoes, peas, wheat, barley, fruit, and to fix the tires on their cart.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each member has. Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will continue to grow, and they will own their own homes.

loans.use: Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam need loans of 200, 600, and 600 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying clothing, potatoes, peas, wheat, barley, fruit, and to fix the tires on their cart.

loans.name: Nansana Church B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gertrude K.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Gertrude is 42 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 18 to 26 and her children go to school. Each week, Gertrude makes approximately UGX 75000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a piggery business. Gertrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to purchase clothes and bed sheets and the loan was paid back on time.

Gertrude is joined in her small group by Irene N., Irene L., Agnes N., and Josephine K.. Irene N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add stock. Irene L. is currently operating a business selling fresh foods and wants a loan to construct a stall. Agnes N. operates a business selling snacks and wants to construct a shade for her business. Josephine K. is currently in the business of dairy farming and is requesting a loan to buy cattle feed.

loans.use: To purchase and stock large volumes of clothes

loans.name: Željka

texts.en: Željka lives in the town Foča with her 11-year-old  child who attends fifth grade at primary school. She is a widow and she has monthly  pension  in the amount of  US$ 380. This is her third loan  through MCO WWI . Željka intends to use this loan in the amount of  US$ 975 to buy material to make handicrafts. She is going to sell her handicrafts in order to expand the business  and increase their monthly income for her and her son.

loans.use: To buy material for handicrafts

loans.name: Mirgasim

texts.en: Mirgasim  A. is 57-year-old married father of three living in Imishli, Azerbaijan. For the past 12 years, he has earned a living by selling spare car parts. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars. With the money, he plans on buying machine oil that is used in foreign cars, such as Mercedes and Nissans.

loans.use: To buy more car oil for a spare parts business

loans.name: Tai

texts.fr:
Tai D., 46 years old, is married with 6 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 7 years. She runs a business selling clothing (outfits) and jewelry (gold-plated necklaces). With her income, she participates in the support of her family, notably in taking care of the children's education, clothing, and health. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Tai D., 46 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente d’habits (des ensembles) et de bijoux (colliers en plaqué or). Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille notamment dans la prise en charge de la scolarité, de l’habillement et la santé. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Marta Iris O. G. is a native of the city of Bluefields, she is 42 years old, and is married to Mr. Margarito Torres who is owner of a butcher shop.  They have four children;  one is in secondary school, and three study in university.  With her business income Mrs. O. pays her children’s educational expenses.  Mrs. O. has sold cheese, cream, curd, and eggs for more than 20 years, having as clients state institutions (hospital, police, and naval district) and the passers-by who prefer her for the variety of dairy products she offers.  This is the second loan for this small businesswoman.  It should be pointed out that the demand for the products that she sells has not decreased, as they are highly consumed by the population.  Now she needs to buy:  362 pounds of cheese at US$1.00 per pound and 150 pounds of cream at US$0.92 a pound.  With this loan she will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of her clients.


 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La microempresaria Marta Iris O. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Margarito Torres quien es propietario de una carnicería, ambos tienen 4 hijos, 1 cursa estudios secundarios y 3 de ellos estudian  en la universidad,  con el ingreso del negocio la Sra. O. paga los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. La Sra. O.  vende queso, crema, cuajada y huevo por más de 20 años, teniendo como clientes  a las instituciones del estado (hospital, Policía y el Distrito Naval) y los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos lácteos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 362 libras de queso a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 150 libras de crema a $ 0.92 centavos dólar la libra,  con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cheese and cream

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky O. is 52 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Lucky is into the sale and repair of electronics. He learned this business for 18 months and he started his own business in 1992. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years. Lucky needs the loan amount of US$ 1, 200 to buy more electronics for re-sale. He says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Alicia lives with her partner; she is 28 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the neighborhood 27 of Octover. Her house is made of raw material, and it is there where she has a small store where she sells groceries, fruit, meats, and cereal. She operates the store with the help of her children and most especially her brother who lives with her. Alicia also works as a literacy tutor in her neighborhood in the afternoons.

Alicia needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks. Alicia hopes to build her home out of decent materials, would like her business to grow and wishes her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Alicia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vive en la asociación 27 de octubre, su casa es de material rustico en donde tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, carnes, cereales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y principalmente de su hermano que vive con ella. Alicia además trabaja como alfabetizadora de adultos en su barrio actividad que realiza por las tardes.

Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas. Alicia sueña con construir su casa de material noble, su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Alicia needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito inició el negocio porque deseaba tener un ingreso estable ya que trabajo en varias empresas pero solo le daban contratos temporales y sus ingresos variaban mucho, motivo por el cual tuvo muchos problemas con su primera esposa y eso ocasionó que se divorciara, fue por eso que decidió poner su negocio. Comenzó en Agosto de 1976, cuando un amigo lo invitó a trabajar en una obra en donde tenía que instalar protectores de ventanas y una reja. A partir de ese trabajo le salieron mas clientes y hasta la fecha me ha ido muy bien.

El necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar herramienta de trabajo que le permita llevar a cabo los trabajos que tiene pendientes y no quedar mal con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarito began the business because he wanted to have a stable income. He already worked in various businesses, but he was only given temporary contracts and his income was extremely variable. This was the reason he had many problems with his first wife, and even caused them to divorce. Because of this, he decided to open his business. He began in August of 1976, when a friend invited him to work on a project in which he had to install window coverings and bars. Because of this work many clients came to him and from this date it has gone very well. He needs a loan of US $275 that he would repay in 4 months in order to buy tools for his work that would allow him to finish the jobs that he has waiting and not disappoint his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for work

loans.name: Elisa Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia sueña en grande, vela por el porvenir educativo y personal de su hija, única persona con quien vive, pues ha proyectado abrir cabinas de Internet en su casa (por ahora sólo cuenta con 2 PC's en casa, el negocio: tipeos) para lo que necesitaría implementar su casa en cuanto a seguridad, así como ver por la venta de licores que expende en su bodega. Ella siempre ve todos los medios posibles en pro de sacar adelante a su hija.

Es por ello que requiere de un préstamo de 1600 soles, los que financiarían su pequeño proyecto de negocio, y vida a la vez, por lo que significaría para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia drams big. She sees for the educational and personal wellbeing of her daughter, who is the only person with whom she lives, since she has planned to open cyber-cafe booths in her home (for now she only has 2 PCs in her home, with which she does typing for a business). She will need to implement better security in her home to set up that business, as well as the sale of liquors she sells in her general store. She is always looking for every way possible to get her daughter ahead. This is why she is requesting a loan of 1600 Soles, with which she'll finance her small business project, and life at the same time for herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply of goods for her liquor store and to purchse more computers to set up a cyber-cafe service, and the respective ambience needed

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carla Patricia González M. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, tiene desde hace 5 años una pulpería ubicada en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad conocido como Loma Fresca y por medio de este negocio ayuda a su marido en los gastos del hogar y a la vez le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos y sus propios estudios universitarios.

Por la lejanía del lugar y valorando que el sector donde vive existen pocas pulperías le permite tener bastantes clientes lo que garantiza la venta de sus productos, sin embargo por no contar con capital suficiente no puede tener variedad de productos ni productos cárnicos (res, cerdo) que son parte de la dieta de los costeños y de esta manera pierde posibles ingresos, por tal razón requiere se le apoye con un  financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Docenas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 11 cada docena, 24 unidades de leche la lechera a US$ 3.50 cada unidad,  quintales de arroz nacional el cual compra a US$ 49  cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidón, 1 exhibidor el cual compra US$ 80, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico  US$ 15.50 cada bolsón y  20 sacos de carbón a US$ 3 cada saco.
texts.en:
Ms. Carla Patricia González M. is 34 years old, married and has two minor children. For 5 years, she has owned a grocery store in a suburb called Loma Fresca. Thanks to the grocery store, she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, as well as paying for her children's schooling and her own university studies. Because of the remoteness of where she lives and the fact that there are few grocery stores nearby, she has many customers, which guarantees the sale of her products. However, due to a lack of working capital, she is unable to offer a greater variety of products, nor can she offer meat products (beef, pork) which are part of the diet of the local coastal people and therefore she is losing potential revenue. She needs you to help her with a loan which she will use to buy the following: 3 dozen 3-minute soups at $11.00 USD per dozen, 24 units of milk at $3.50 per unit, 2 100lb bags of national rice (each bag costs $49 USD), 2 100lb bags of sugar at $28 USD each, 2 100lb bags of beans at $54 USD per bag, 2 bulk cans of oil at $25 USD each, 1 display case which costs $80 USD, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper which each cost $15.50 USD and 20 bags of coal at $3 USD per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 dozen 3-minute soups, 24 units of milk, 2 100lb bags of national rice, 2 100lb bags of sugar, 2 100lb bags of beans, 2 bulk cans of oil, 1 display case for candies, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper and 20 bags of coal.

loans.name: Tahira Khadim Hussain Group

texts.en:
Tahira Baji is a 40 year old lady who resides in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places.  People come to visit Pakpattan to make wishes in shrine places.  She believes that she is blessed to be a part of this city. 

Tahira Baji completed her education up until the 10th standard.  She then married a man who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters.  All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  

Tahira Baji has a clothes sewing business.  She learned this art from her mother.  She earns worth 1500 Pak Rupees per month, which she uses to pay her children’s school fees.  She is applying for a loan to repair her hsuband’s auto-rickshaw. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her community.  Sakina Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.  Sumera Rani Baji wants a loan to buy spare parts of vehicles to resell.  Maryam Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.  Anwar Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: VICENTE ES UN SEÑOR DE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, SU FAMILIA SE CONSTITYE DE TRES MIEMBROS, ÉL SU ESPOSA Y SU HIJO. EL SR. VICENTE R. OÑA TIENE BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN EL SECTOR DE TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS (MOTOTAXI), TAMBIEN DESARROLLA SUS ACTIVIDADES COMO ALBAÑIL. LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA DEBIDO A QUE EXISTEN UN NUMERO CONSIDERABLE DE MOTOTAXISTAS Y DE ALBAÑILES PERO POR OTRA PARTE TAMBIEN EXISTE MUCHA DEMANDA PARA LOS ALBAÑILES DEBIDO AL CRECIMIENTO DE SECTOR CONTRUCCION. EL PRESENTE CREDITO ES PARA LA REFACCION DE VIVIENDA. CLIENTE CON MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO MANTIENE CERO DIAS DE MORA EN SU ANTERIOR OPERACION.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 31-year old man, and there are three members of his family, himself, his wife and his son. Mr. Vicente R. Oña has a lot of experience transporting passengers (by mototaxi), and also works as a bricklayer. There is a lot of competition because there are a large number of mototaxi drivers and bricklayers, but at the same time there is also a lot of demand for bricklayers because of the growth of the construction industry. This loan will be used to repair his house. He has a very good credit history and never made a late payment on his previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair home

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa N. is 30 years old. She is married and has two children - a son and a daughter. The son is studying at an elementary school, while the daughter is yet to start. Yaa's family lives in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a suburb of the city of Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a farming as well as a commercial community, and the majority of its inhabitants are farmers or traders. Yaa works hard to help her husband financially support the family. Her husband is a mechanic who owns a workshop and earns money repairing damaged vehicles. Yaa buys tubers of yam from Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from the surrounding villages and then sells fresh yam in the local market square as well as distributes it to food vendors in her community. She has been in this business for about five years. Currently, Yaa needs a loan to buy tubers of yam in bulk in order to cut down on cost that she otherwise incurs as a result of the frequent trips to procure the yam tubers. She hopes to thereby increase her business profit margin and be able to better support her husband in paying for their children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of tubers of yam for sale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị L. năm nay  58 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con  tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ trồng rau và nuôi cá . Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu sự hỗ trợ của các con . Với thu nhập  2.500.000.đ/ tháng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có điều kiện hơn để cải thiện cuộc sống.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ  để đầu tư mua thêm cá giống, gà giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi L. is 58 years old. She is living with her husband and child in Ninh Giang district, Hai Duong province. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2004. Currently, the major source of income of her family is from growing vegetables and raising fishes. In addition, she also receives financial support from her children. With an income of VND2,500,000 per month, her family has the resources to improve the condition of living.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy more baby fishes, baby chickens, and foods for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more baby fishes, baby chickens to raise, and foods for them.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: Coralia R. de 39 años de edad reside en la colonia San José en el departamento de Ahuachapán, junto a su madre de edad muy avanzada. Ella trabaja en su propia pupusería en donde vende café, chocolate para beber, sodas y pupusas (estas ultimas son un platillo muy típico salvadoreño, el cuál es muy parecido a una tortilla, la cual esta hecha de maza de maíz revuelta con queso, frijoles y chicharrón). Dicha pupusería esta ubicada frente al Seguro Social de Ahuachapán, Coralia tiene la suerte de tener muchos clientes, ya que su negocio esta ubicado muy cerca de la terminal de buses. Coralia es conocida por ser una mujer muy dedicada, responsable, la cuál pone todas sus ganas a su trabajo, ya que ella es la única que trabaja en su hogar y debe obtener el dinero necesario para sustentar las necesidades de su madre y de ella misma. Es por esto que Coralia solicita un préstamo a través del cuál logre invertir más en su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Coralia R. is 39 years old and resides in the San José neighborhood in the department of Ahuachapán, together with her elderly mother. She works in her own restaurant that specializes in pupusas where she sells coffee, chocolate for drinking, sodas and pupusas (the latter is a very typical Salvadoran dish, which is very similar to a tortilla, made from corn dough with cheese, beans and fried pork rinds). This pupusería is located in front of the Social Security building of Ahuachapan. Coralia is fortunate to have many customers because her business is located near the bus terminal. Coralia is known for being a very dedicated and responsible woman who gives her all to her work since she is the only one who works in her home and she should get the money needed to sustain the needs of her mother and herself. This is why Coralia is applying for a loan through which she can invest more in her business and obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business productivity

location.town: Colonia San José, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia Elizabeth P. V. de 42 años de edad, reside en Ilopango junto a su esposo y dos hijas, la mayor de 23 años y la menor de 6 años, y con una nieta de 18 meses de edad. Ella se dedica a fabricar trajes para señoras, los cuales los distribuye en el oriente del país. Silvia Elizabeth solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio comprando materia prima para fabricar más vestidos, de esta manera ella anhela incrementar sus ventas, y así poder brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia, ya que por medio de su negocio es como logran obtener las mayores ganancias. Es así como Silvia desea poder mejorar su negocio y así mismo mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia, brindando mayor variedad de vestidos y obteniendo mayores ganancias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia Elizabeth P. V. is 42 years old and lives in Ilopango with her husband and two daughters, a 23 year old and a 6 year old, and a granddaughter who is 18 months old. She manufactures womens' dresses which she distributes in the eastern part of the country. Silvia Elizabeth requests a loan which she will use as capital to invest in her business by purchasing material to make more dresses. This way she hopes to increase her sales and thus allow her to provide everything necessary for her family since her business is what allows them to obtain greater income. By offering a greater variety of clothes and obtaining more profits from her customers, Silvia hopes to improve her business and at the same time improve the economic stability of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make dresses.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi T., 38, is married and has 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the people in the market, 2 days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~65USD).  SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used for the business and for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase timber, iron roofing, cement, vegetable seeds and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Neema is 20 years old, and is married. She has been a local alcohol maker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya  for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $230. Every day she works at her business for ten hours.

Neema is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation, and to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru: Абдулхамид Вохидов более 20 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он работал бухгалтером, т.к. заработная плата не удовлетворяла он начал свой бизнес. Абдулхамид сеет рис, собирает и продает на базаре. Проживает он в районе Хамадони. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Ему по бизнесу также помогают его дети. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы собрать первый урожай и посеить второй. Собрав второй урожай продать его.
texts.en:
Abdulhamid Vahidov has been farming for over 20 years. Before that he worked as an accountant, but began his own business because the salary was too low. Abdulhamid grows rice, harvests, and sells it at the market. He lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 54 years old, married, and has five children, who help with the business. He is requesting a loan for harvest of the first crop and planting of the second. He will sell when the second planting is harvested.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvest and replanting

loans.name: Purchase Of Groceries To Restock Her Grocery Shop,

texts.es:
GREIS I. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS”, vive en el Jr. Agustín Cauper N° 245 del distrito de Camporverde, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de transportes.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 10 años, con él, compró algunas prendas más y afianzo su negocio. Actualmente continúa con la venta de ropas usadas y además tiene una pequeña bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega y ropa usada que luego los vende en los caseríos.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante y así estas puedan aportar a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Greis I. S. is a member of the community bank "Las Nazarenas", and lives in Camporverde district. She is 35 years old and has 2 children with her husband who works for a transportation company. She has a business selling second hand clothing. She started the business 10 years ago, with a loan that she invested in the purchase of clothes and the enhancement of her business. She is currently selling second hand clothes and has a small grocery shop as well.

She is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of groceries to restock her grocery shop, and second hand clothing that she will sell in the villages. During the short time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, she has been happy for the help given to women to succeed, so they can contribute to provide for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

borrowers.first_name: Purchase Of Groceries To Restock Her Grocery Shop,

loans.name: Behildes

texts.en: Behildes D. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Behildes owns and operates a business selling crabs and shrimps in the local community. She has been engage in the business for three years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Behildes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Behildes is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de unos familiares y tiene mucho deseo de salir adelante. Para ella, el negocio de fabricar muebles es una actividad muy rentable, desde muy niña siempre le gusto trabajar con la madera, ya que su padre tenía una carpintería y ahora ella que tiene la suya propia se siente muy feliz. Marleny trabaja junto a sus hermanos, quienes también decidieron dedicarse a la carpintería. Ella disfruta de manejar las maquinarias y de darle su toque femenino a los muebles acabados, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cortar las maderas, ya que siempre hay peligro de que suceda algún percance. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una carpintería más grande donde pueda trabajar profesionalmente. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Marleny con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más madera para fabricar nuevos muebles y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marleny, 25, is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her relatives’ house, and she has a great desire to get ahead. The business of making furniture is very profitable for her. Since she was a very young girl, she has always liked to work with wood. Her father had a carpentry shop, and now that she has her own she feels very happy. Marleny works together with her siblings, who also decided to do carpentry work. She enjoys working the machines and giving her feminine touch to the furniture’s finishing details. She has been in this business for ten years. The most difficult thing about her work is cutting the wood, because there is always the danger of an accident. In the near future she hopes to have a larger carpentry shop where she can work professionally. This is Marleny’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to pay it on time, and she is prepared to do so. She wants to access future loans. She is very happy in her community bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wood to make new furniture and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco A. I. tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando.
el se dedica a la compra y venta de pan blanco, dulce y galletas de todo tipo, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, el esta ubicado en el barrio Moranzan de la ciudad de Nacaome, el ahora tiene su propio carro y se traslada a diferentes caserios y colonias cercanas de donde el vive.
en estos ultimos meses ha tenido una demanda muy grande con el producto que vende y desea comprar mas pan para poder tener mejores ventas ya que el pan solo se compra en la mañana por ser fresco.
su mayor sueño es tener una fabrica de produccion de pan.
el necesita el credito para comprar mas pan todos los dias.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. I. is 59 years old, married, and has two children (one of which is in school). He buys and sells white bread, sweet breads, and cookies of all kinds. He has been doing this for 14 years. He lives in Moranzan, a neighborhood in the city Nacaome. He now has his own cart and goes to different farmhouses and neighborhoods in his area. In the past few months, he has had great demand for his products, and wishes to buy more bread, so that he can improve his sales -- he only buys bread in the morning, so that it will be fresh. His biggest dream is to have a bread factory. He needs the loan so that he can buy more bread every day.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more white bread and sweet bread, and cookies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old married man with 1 child. He has been working as an electrician since 1992. After this long experience in the field, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy new tools so he can satisfy the demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy atenta, tiene 51 años, es separada, tiene 5 hijos y actualmente vive sola en su casa. Anteriormente se dedicaba a diversos oficios a fin de solventar sus necesidades, pero la mayoría de sus ganancias las gastaba en el pago del alquiler de su cuarto mensualmente. Después de mucho trabajo y esfuerzo logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa de madera y desde entonces ha dejado de hacer trabajos pesados. Con su casa propia, Gloria optó por dedicarse a la venta de bebidas y licor de “uña de gato”, el cual es usado como medicina natural y es muy demandado por sus clientes.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrando ser una cliente responsable y muy interesada en el progreso de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de néctares y diversas bebidas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very considerate woman. She is 51 years old, separated, and has 5 children. Gloria currently lives by herself in her own home. She previously held a variety of jobs in order to meet her expenses, with most of her earnings going toward her monthly rent. After much work and effort, she managed to buy a piece of land where she built a wooden house and has since stopped working heavily. From her own home, Gloria decided to sell beverages and “cat’s claw” elixir, which is used as a natural medicine and in high demand by her customers.

This is Gloria’s second loan with MFP. She has demonstrated that she is a responsible client and very interested in the progress of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to buy nectars and various beverages to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nectars and various beverages to restock her business

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen T. is from the village of P-4 Malibangcao Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Gretchen is married.

To make a living, Gretchen owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gretchen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gretchen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sister

texts.fr: K. Sister est née vers 1969 et vit dans le quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis onze ans. Sister est divorcée et a quatre enfants tous scolarisés à sa charge, dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Sister vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Sister n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et exerce depuis dix ans la vente du riz, d’œufs et d’huile végétale qu’elle distribue. Sister fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Sister a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIdé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement et réaliser plus d'économie afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, Sister sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sister K. was born about 1969 and has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for the last 11 years. She is divorced and is the mother and responsible for four school aged children. Sister lives alone with her children and is solely responsible for the needs of the family. She did not have the opportunity to attend school and has been selling and distributing rice, eggs, and vegetable oil for the last ten years. Sister buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already made two loans with ALIde, which have been duly repaid. To strengthen her business operating funds, and better meet the needs of both her customers and her children, Sister is requesting this third ALIde loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, cans of oil and crates of eggs for resale

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice E. is requesting a loan through ASHI to be able to grow her cow and pig raising and selling business. For two years now this business has given Janice the opportunity to have her own income and to augment the income of her husband, a fisherman.

Janice spends her business proceeds for the education of her four children whose ages range from 3 to 13 years old.

Janice, 27 years old, knows how hard it is to live a life when a person is very poor. That is why loans she accesses through ASHI are used very well to finance her business so it becomes stable and she can help support the needs of her family, especially her children’s education until college.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet and cow for a livestock raising business.

loans.name: Clenie

texts.en:
Clenie is 31, married, has three children and takes care of four dependents with ages ranging from 2 to 10. Clenie lives in the northern province of Rwanda in a place called Ruhengeli, approximately 2 hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.  Clenie is a proven businesswoman, she has had a shop selling a variety of goods since 1999. She works long hours; her shop is open from 8 AM to 6 PM every day.

Although Clenie has been in business since 1999, she struggles each month to make a decent profit and she believes that a small amount of additional capital to buy more and better inventory would change that for her.  For this reason, Clenie is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to purchase a variety of attractive goods for sale which she thinks her customers will want.   She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Krin

texts.en: Mrs. Krin N. is 40 years old and she lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She breeds ducks and chickens. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducklings and duck food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Hun Nhor, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a security guard; two are attending the local school and the remaining stays at home. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: By purchasing more ducklings and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Alejandro Secundino

texts.es: El Señor Alejandro G. tiene 48 años de edad, es Casado y con oficios  Comerciante,  cuenta con  un pequeño negocio habita junto  a su esposa, y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio,  lleva 12 años  de Vender,   su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Choatzam, del Cantón Juchanep del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en las que se encuentran no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro G. is 48 and married. He has a small business. He lives with his wife, and she is in the same business. He has been selling for 12 years. His house is in Paraje Choatzam in the Juchanep canton, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently his customer demand has grown, but the economic condition he finds himself in is not sufficient to augment his capital. That is the reason he has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. His intention is to buy more merchandise. That way he will be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead so that they can have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon H. is a villager in Bam village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bet Ry, is a pig middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Phon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy five more pigs to resell to earn more income. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is a construction worker and the other attends the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy five more pigs

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam R. is 23 years old, and she sells fruit in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years, and she makes 1.60 USD every day. Her husband is a construction worker in homebuilding. On average, he makes 4 USD a day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business. There is high inflation, and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 500 USD to make a new investment. She would like to sell chickens during Chinese New Year.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sénoumé Fidèle

texts.fr: Z. Sénoumé Fidèle est née le 26 avril 1981 à Enagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit toujours.  Sénoumé Fidèle est mariée à HONFO Bienvenu, un électricien, et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Sénoumé Fidèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Sénoumé Fidèle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Sénoumé Fidèle vend divers produits pour cheveux à Akpakpa dodomé. Sénoumé Fidèle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sénoumé Fidèle s’approvisionne.  Sénoumé Fidèle a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Sénoumé Fidèle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Sénoumé Fidèle Z. was born on April 26, 1981 in the neighborhood of Enagnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and still lives there. She is married to Bienvenu Honfo, an electrician, and is the mother of two children who attend school. She lives with her husband and her children. Both parents provide for their family. Sénoumé Fidèle never attended school. To provide for herself, Sénoumé Fidèle has sold hair products in Akpakpa-Dodomé for 5 years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She was already granted a loan by Alidé which she repaid on schedule. Sénoumé Fidèle came now to Alidé and applied for another loan which she will use to bolster her business and better keep up with her customers' demand.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with a child and she is 30 years old. She is a friendly and hardworking woman who sells for long hours to support her home. Her husband also works to support their home.

Deborah sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers and is well-known in her community. She has a stall where she sells her foodstuffs and hopes to be a major foodstuffs distributor in the future. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

Deborah says “THANK YOU” to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Arwo

texts.en:
Arwo R. is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock high quality clothes and sandals. Arwo is 29 and married. Her husband is a clerk, and they have two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock high quality clothes and sandals

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia G. operates a rice retail business and tends to a fishing business at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The businesses are a big help for her family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. 

This couple is requesting a new loan of 45,000 Philippine pesos to buy a motorboat, fishnet, bamboo and gasoline, and to cover labor expenses. The proceeds of the business support the immediate and basic needs of her family. Leticia hopes that her businesses will become successful some day. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, she hopes to see the graduation of her child from college and to see him find a stable job. She also still dreams of having a durable and concrete house for the safety of her family and she wants to save for her family’s future. 

Leticia wishes to thank Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. This is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy a motorboat, fishnet, bamboo and gasoline and pay for labor expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools like hoes, fertilizer and mulches

loans.name: Haidy

texts.en:
Haidy A. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Haidy owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating motor transport services. Haidy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Haidy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Haidy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle in order to offer better service. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Son 5 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando principalmente papa y en ocasiones maíz y alfalfa, siendo éste último para alimentar a sus animales. Durante la temporada de siembra y cosecha,  toda su familia participa de esta tarea, en donde prepararan la tierra y al momento de la recolección de su producción es necesario el contrato de peones que ayuden en la labor. A parte del trabajo agrícola que realiza, también se dedica a la comercialización de sus productos, de esa manera obtiene la ganancias necesarias. Paralelo es este trabajo también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y cada cierto tiempo sus compradores la buscan para obtener estos animales, puesto que ella posee cuyes de buena raza y bien alimentados. Estas actividades le permiten a Gladys  estar en su casa y atender a sus hijos, además que es un gran apoyo para la economía de su hogar. Mas adelante desea  mejorar  la calidad de sus cosechas y abundante. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y por tanto promete en ser puntual con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar sacos de abono y materiales de construcción para la elaboración de galpones para darles mayor espacio a sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children. For 5 years, she has been raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also works in agriculture, planting mainly potatoes and sometimes corn and alfalfa, the latter for feeding her animals. During the planting and harvesting seasons, her whole family participates in the work, preparing the soil. When the time comes to harvest, it's necessary to hire workers to help with the work. In addition to the farm work she does, she also sells her products, thus obtaining needed profits. At the same time, she raises guinea pigs and after a certain amount of time, her buyers seek her out to obtain these animals, since she has well bred and well fed guinea pigs. These activities allow Gladys to be in her house and raise her children, and they are a great support for her family's finances. In the future, she wants to improve the quality and quantity of her crops. This is her fourth loan with MFP and therefore she promises to make her payments on time. She also thinks this loan will be very useful to progress her business. With the loan, she will buy sacks of fertilizer and construction materials to make shelters to give her guinea pigs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and construction materials for a guinea pig shelter.

loans.name: Umutkan's Group

texts.en:
Umutkan D. is the leader of the group. She is 37 and married. Her husband works as a constructor and earns 10,000 soms per month. They have three sons. One son studies at school. The other sons do not go to school yet. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Umutkan began to take orders, sew and sell national cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she makes 15,000 soms per month. The success of the past five years made it possible for her to purchase three sewing machines, hire workers and rent an office. With money received from the loan, Umutkan wants to purchase fabric and materials. In the future, she plans to expand her business and buy a vehicle.

Eliza K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 32. In order to earn some money, her husband works at two jobs as a constructor and as a taxi driver.  They have two daughters and a son; all of them study at school. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Eliza bought six farm animals and resold them after fattening. She made good money and since that moment, Eliza has been breeding livestock. Now she makes 5,000 soms per month and with the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding.

Eliza A. is 22 and divorced. She works as a waitress. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Eliza bought five farm animals and started to breed them. In two years, she increased the number of livestock to 12. Eliza applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase some calves for breeding. In autumn, when the price will be higher, she plans to resell them and make some money.

Narynbek T. is 25 and married. He works at the police department and a year ago, with an initial investment of 8,000 soms, he bought two farm animals and started to breed them. He applied for the loan because needs money to purchase more farm animals to increase the number of livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Veurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Veurn T. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Damnak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Noeun Chea, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

With the farm, they do not make enough income to support their family, thus Mrs. Veurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding, as well as to buy fertilizer and to pay for laborer to plow her farm. 

This couple has a child who is four years old. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Olga Judith

texts.fr: K. Olga Judith est née le 06 Octobre 1968 à Dogbo, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Mariée à PANOU Hervé, Olga Judith a un enfant à sa charge et qui n'est pas scolarisé. Olga Judith vit avec son mari et l'enfant à charge à Agbalilamè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis trois ans que Olga Judith s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Olga Judith a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis sept ans et qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. C'est la première fois que Olga Judith sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'acquérir des matériels de couture nécessaire au bon fonctionnement de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Olga Judith K. was born on October 6 1968 in Dogbo, in the department of Mono, Benin. Married to Hervé Panou, Olga Judith has one child in her care, who has not received schooling. Olga Judith lives with her husband and the child in her care in Agbalilamè, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, having moved there three years ago. Together, the couple take care of the various family expenses. Olga Judith left school at the secondary level and then learned sewing, an activity that she has carried out for seven years and which allows her to meet her family's needs. This is the first time that Olga Judith has asked for a loan from ALIDé, in order to obtain the sewing supplies that she needs to properly run her business and meet her customers' requests.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rolls of poplin, thread, etc.

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en:
Faalaniga M. is 18 and married with no children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Faalaniga has 1 year of experience in this business.  Faalaniga needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.


In 2010, Faalaniga joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Faalaniga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy N. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Joy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Joy is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand services

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana A. vende lotería en el mercado Israel lewite ambulante.
Ella trabaja de 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, e madre soltera de una hija la cual se encuentra en la universidad.
Ella ha trabajado con ceprodel nueve créditos los cuales han sido para invertir en su negocio.
El préstamo solicitado es para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: Loteria, chalupa y raspadita.
Ana dice que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a hora cuenta con dos corredores que le entrega lotería.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A. sells lottery tickets at the Israel Lewite Market as a street vendor. She works from 9am until 5pm. Ana is a single mother with a daughter who is attending the university.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for nine loan cycles and used the proceeds to invest in her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy lottery tickets, “Chalupa” bingo games, and scratch cards. Ana says she is grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided because she is able to work with two brokers who administer the lottery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets, bingo games, and scratch cards

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián es una persona muy agradable y responsable, pero sobre todo muy trabajador, el trabaja como despachador en una gasolinera, tiene poco tiempo separado de su esposa, y aunque ah sufrido mucho, le ha echado muchas ganas para  seguir adelante, y también tiene un pequeño estante para limpiar zapatos por los fines de semana. Este seria el segundo crédito con nosotros, en esta ocasión en señor Adrián necesita el dinero para iniciar la contracción de un cuartito, ya que el lugar en donde vive es muy chico.
texts.en:
Adrian is a very pleasant and responsible person but, above all, he is a hard-worker. He works as a gasoline station attendant. He has recently separated from his wife and although he has suffered a great deal, he has a strong desire to carry on. He also has a small shoe shine stand where he works on weekends. This would be his second loan with us. This time, Adrian needs the money to start building a room onto his house because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Xuan T. L. is 46 years old. She has two children who are workers for an industrial park. Xuan has been running her farming activities for years and has considerabL. income from this. Currently, she is raising 20 pigs for meat, which is sold wholesaL.. Joining with our credit program in 2006, she has used loans effectively and has a good repayment history.
