To expand her business, she wants to borrow a loan of 8,502,000 VND .

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suubi Development Association-Kampala Group

texts.en: It may seem like a recycled cliche, but most business owners in Uganda attribute their start-ups to inspirational pep talk from close family or friends.  Thirty-two-year-old Margret S. is no exception as she says what spawned the idea for her rentals and poultry businesses was motivational talk from friends.  Margret is happily married with 5 children and says it was about 6 years ago when she started this business. Margret is a dedicated, hardworking, and steadfast woman.   Her business generates 25,000 shillings for her a week. She says she will buy more broilers for her poultry business. She belongs to Suubi Development Association-Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for her poultry business

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La joven María Lourdes R. P. es una comerciante que se dedica a vender churros, donas, pasteles, etc. Ella realiza las compras en el mercado mayoreo Bisne y realiza las ventas en las acercas de su casa y su comunidad. 
Ella vende diario sus productos y trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años y lleva 20 créditos, es una excelentísima clienta muy responsable con todos sus pagos es acompañada y tiene 3 niños.
Ella habita en el Rpto. La florida.
texts.en:
The young María Lourdes R. P. is a merchant who sells churros, donuts, cakes, etc.  She makes her purchases in the wholesale Bisne market, and makes her sales in the area surrounding her house, and in her community.

She sells her products daily.  She has been working with CEPRODEL for 3 years and has taken 20 loans over that time.  She is an excellent client who is very responsible with all of her payments.  She has a partner and 3 children.

She lives in the La Florida housing development.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto tiene 30 años, el se dedica a la venta de bolsas plásticas. Desde hace mas 5 año, el es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de mucho de su trabajo y de interactuar con sus clientes. El se levanta temprano todos los días pues sabe que tiene que vender sus productos y recorrer mucho lugares, la necesidad de mantener a su familia es lo que lo ha motivado por esforzarse y seguir adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Sueña con establecer su propio negocio.
texts.en: Cesar Augusto is thirty years old and has made a living selling plastic bags for five years.  He is a very responsible person who really enjoys his work and interacting with customers.  He gets up early everyday because he knows he has to sell his products and travel to many places.  The need to support his family motivates him to make the effort and to get ahead. The loan is to buy raw materials.  He dreams of establishing his own business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).  Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que él es ebanista ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. 

Poco a poco incremento su clientela vendiendo perfumes desde $ 20.00, cremas a $ 6.00,  bisutería desde su casa con unas vitrinas que compro para que la gente que pasara viera los productos. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 16h00pm desde su casa y en ocasiones con el catalogo a sus conocidos.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere alquilar un local amplio para vender toda la línea de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 54, sells Yambal products (Yambal is a business that offers enterprising women the opportunity to start selling independently).  In order to help her husband, a cabinetmaker, with the household expenses, she started to work selling Yambal products.

Little by little she has gotten more customers.  She sells perfume starting at $20, creams for $6, and costume jewelry from her house.  She bought some display cases so that the people passing by would see her products.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She works from her house, and she sometimes sells by catalog to her acquaintances.

She wants to use the loan to buy Yambal products like perfume, cream, and clothes.  In the future she wants to rent an ample space in order to sell the entire line of products.

loans.use: Perfumes and creams

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El señor Simón R. T. tiene 46 años casado con la Señora Leónidas Hinojosa Morales de R. mas de 9 años, tienen 3 hijos menores dependientes, viven en sector de Aguirre que está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

El Sr Simón es agricultor produce papa, haba y también viaja a Yapacani llevando los productos agrícolas a vender juntamente con la esposa, es una persona humilde pero trabajador, él necesita dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico, semilla de papa, para ello es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos, Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona y otorgar crédito, el Sr. Simón está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora va poder comprar los insumos agrícolas así va tener más ingresos económicos para hacer estudiar a sus 3 hijos menores y ahora para mejor la vivienda que habita.
texts.en:
Mr. Simón R. T. is 46 years old and has been married to Mrs. Leónidas Hinojosa Morales de R. for over 9 years. Together they have 3 underage children, and live in the Aguirre area that is located 42 km from the city of Cochabamba.

Mr. Simón is a farmer and grows potatoes and haba beans, he also goes to Yapacani and takes his agricultural products to sell with his wife. He is a very humble but hardworking person, Mr. Simón needs the money to buy items for his crops such as organic manure and potato seeds, it is very difficult to go the banks in the city since they have too many requirements which is why he chose to take the initiative to go to that area and get the loan. Mr. Simón is very happy to have received the loan and he will now be able to buy his agricultural products so that he can have more income to send his 3 underage children to school and to improve the home which he inhabits.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir principalmente frutas como el mango,la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Ella cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral en su domicilio. Los alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrera agrícola en un fundo de la zona especializado en el cultivo de maracuyá. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Teodora desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y hacer que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera para que los pueda vender a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Teodora is 32 years old.  She is a single mother and lives together with her two children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which is noted for producing fruit such as mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Teodora raises and sells animals.  She raises sheep, pigs and poultry from her home.  She feeds her animals grains and natural fodder and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who always visit the area where she lives.

Teodora also works as an agricultural laborer on a large farm in the area which specializes in growing passion fruit.  The income that she makes from these activities allows her to get her family ahead financially.  Teodora would like to acquire feed so that she can better raise her animals and ensure that they develop as well as possible so that she can sell them for a better price.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire feed to better raise her animals

loans.name: Agusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Agusto; El socio tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente; el socio tiene 3 hijos, el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de autos, el socio compra con un capital que lo tiene trabajando durante años y compra autos de la frontera de segunda y los trae a su natal Tipon a vender a sus amigos y otros, el socio apoya a su conyugue en su restaurante los fines de semana y de este modo todo lo que ingresa se sigue ahorrando para poder dar la mejor educación a sus hijos, el socio desea el crédito para poder aumentar a su capital para la compra de otro vehículo que le pidieron y esta a puertas de viajar a la frontera entre Perú y Chile para traer el vehículo. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar a su capital y adquirir un auto para la venta.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Agusto is part of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON” communal bank, located in the Tipon district and within the province and department of Cusco.

Agusto is 49 years old, in a cohabiting relationship, and has three children.  He buys and sells cars at the border, with his own capital, and imports them to Tipon to sell to his friends and to others.

He helps his partner in her restaurant on the weekends and saves what he earns there, so that he will be able to provide for a good education for his children.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a car that was requested of him.  He is getting ready to travel to the Chile-Peru border to bring it.

He is grateful for this loan and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy a car for resale

loans.name: Dolores  Roxana

texts.es: Dolores  Roxana S. M. de 29 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Chalatenango,  en donde vive junto a su esposo y sus pequeños hijo. Dolores es una persona muy responsable, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Ella  posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos  y de primera necesidad. Dolores cuenta con muy buena ubicación y es esto lo cual le permite contar con más cantidad de clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy amable. Dolores desea poder surtir su negocio, comprando productos nuevos como golosinas, pasta dental y otros más. Ella desea poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que ella tiene para poder brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario para tener una vida aceptable en la cual se cuente con lo más básico.
texts.en: Dolores Roxana S. M. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and small children in the Chalatenango department.  Dolores is a very responsible person with good references from her neighbors.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products and perishable items.  The store is in a good location, which allows her to have more customers, who prefer buying from her because she is very friendly.  Dolores would like to stock her store buy buying new products such as snacks, toothpaste, and other things.  She would like to increase her sales, since this is her only source of income she has with which to provide for her family’s needs and be able to give them an acceptable life.  At the moment, they only have the basic needs.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Liliana Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. Liliana Cárdenas es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, fue nombrada así por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Liliana tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo su propio taxi, con el sacrificio y trabajo de los dos han construído su casa propia.

La Señora. Liliana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que debe estar al cuidado de sus hijos, pero en su casa se dedica a trabajar en artesanías pintando adornos de cerámica para el hogar el cual vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más adornos de cerámica para pintar. Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana Cárdenas is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank, and lives in the neighborhood of the same name in Cuenca. This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999, for the beautiful architecture of its historic center. The people are very friendly and polite and maintain their culture and traditions.

Liliana is 34 years old and married with 3 children, ages 14, 8 and 5. Her oldest son is in high school, and the younger children attend a primary school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver, and works driving his own taxi. With much work and sacrifice, they have built their own home.  

Lilian works to care for her home, and for her children, but at home she also devotes time to handicrafts, painting ceramic decorations for the home, which she sells to friends and associates. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for 2 years. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more ceramic decorations to be painted. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase ceramic decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her plastic products business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old and married. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods and beverages in her community. Elizabeth has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Lilianne

texts.en: Lilianne is 29 years-old and she has three children aged between two and a half years and seven years-old.  She owns a capentry and sells sorghum and she has had this business for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
doña Maria Ana O. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de sandias en su casa de habitacion, Maria es una mujer de avanzada edad que ya no tiene
hijos pequeños, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sandias al por mayor, dicha fruta es muy sabrosa y tiene bastante demanda.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Maria Ana O. is 54 years old and lives in Las Arenas neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca.  Her business is selling watermelons from her home.  Maria is an older woman who no longer has young children.  She has the support of her husband and together they work hard to get ahead in life.

Maria will use her loan to buy watermelons wholesale.  This fruit is very tasty and in demand.

Maria devotes her spare time to her church.

loans.use: to buy watermelons

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nida is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Nida has a pottery business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for pottery-making.

Nida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for pottery-making.

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en: Ni Putu, 27, is the leader of the group called Puspa Kencana, consisting of 10 members. They are receiving a loan of Rp. 15,000,000 with each member receiving Rp. 1,500,000. Currently, Ni Putu already has a local type of pigs and she will use the loan to buy a superior species of pigs. The price for superior pigs is more expensive than the local species because of the quality of the meat. She hopes by maintaining the superior pigs, she will get more profit so she can help with the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a superior variety of pigs

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en: Edilberta is married and has seven children. She is 41 years old, has five children still in school, and works very hard at her business, selling fish. Edilberta is applying for a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional coolers for storing her fish. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is determined to earn enough money to expand her business and send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional coolers for her fish.

loans.name: Iguguno Group

texts.en:
Leonard is in his early thirties and divorced with one child. His son is too young to go to school.

For the past year Leonard has worked as a brick maker. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. each day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Leonard's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will share this loan with his loan group. The group is called “Iguguno” and has sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Leonard wants to use his loan to make more bricks to sell. His dream is to buy a plot of land upon which to begin farming vegetables.

loans.use: to make more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has 5 daughters ages 3 to 13. He has been making cakes and selling them to all types of customers in the town center. As part of his business, Peter employs 4 people from his community. Peter has been doing this for 7 years. In addition to making cakes, Peter also earns money driving a bodaboda (motorcycle). He plans to use the loan to purchase raw materials needed to make more cakes. 

Peter hopes to expand his business and open two branches in the future. He describes himself as creative and entrepreneurial.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make cakes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 49 years old and married with four children. She works in dairy farming to earn a living and she has been in this business for over three years.  Agnes has improved her business through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to continue growing her business and generating more income. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lima Roselyne

texts.fr:
Célibataire, mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge est varie  entre 8 et 14 ans.
Depuis 2ans, elle s’approvisionne à Kinshasa en bijoux pacotilles qu’elle revend au marché sur un étalage. Elle maitrise la qualité et les modèles actuels pour satisfaire la demande de ses clientes, elle vend par jour 20.000F et pendant les périodes de fêtes, elle atteint 50.000F.

Avec le prêt, elle va acheter : les parures pour les cérémonies, les ensembles colliers-boucles d’oreilles-bracelets-bagues, vernis à ongle.

Son but est d’acheter beaucoup  pour être une fournisseuse  auprès des revendeurs.
texts.en:
This woman is an unmarried mother of three children whose ages vary between 8 and 14.

For 2 years, she has been getting supplies of costume jewelry from Kinshasa and re-selling them at a stand in the market. She has mastered the process of selecting the quality and current styles that her customers are looking for. She sells 20,000 F worth of jewelry per day, and during the festival season she reaches up to 50,000 F.

With this loan, she is going to buy ceremonial jewelry, sets of necklaces-earrings-bracelets-rings, and nail polish.

Her goal is to buy in large quantities in order to be a supplier to retailers.

loans.use: To buy ceremonial jewelry, rings, earrings, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et liqueurs au marché de HEDZRANAWOE depuis 2009, Ama est mère de 02 enfants. Elle est à son premier cycle de crédit à WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des boissons et pagnes afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Son mari est électronicien.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs at the Hedzranawoe market since 2009, Ama is the mother of two children. she is on her first loan cycle with WAGES and is seeking this loan to buy beverages and pagnes in order to respond to her customers' requests. Her husband is an electronics engineer.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her lovely four children. Khat is a farmer who grows rice. According to the rainy season, Khat needs some funds to support her farming business. The loan she is requesting will be used for planting rice. She plans to buy seeds and compost for her rice crop. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crop and the lack of money to pay for farming. Her dreams include making improvements to her house and providing for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for her rice crop.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman with five children. She operates a handbag sales business at Kakamega. She has been in this business for five years now. She says that the business is good and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of KES 80,000 to buy more handbags to sell to her customers while meeting their demand. She sees herself growing her business into wholesale. She describes herself as ambitious, patient and determined.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty eight year old married man. He has three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. He has been in the agricultural sector for ten years. 

John started his business by harvesting two bags of maize in season and now he harvests sixty bags. His hardship is low production in dry season and his vision is harvesting one hundred bags per season. He also has a goal of educating his children. John needs the loan facility to buy maize, beans and soya beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and soya beans for planting.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh was born in 1971. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, in the Duc Tu commune. She is married and has three children. Her family has a workshop in which she has been working for many years with the help of her husband, who is a carpenter.  They have an income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. She has been involved with SEDA since 2006, and always repays her loans punctually. This is her 6th loan cycle. She is borrowing 8,502,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture to sell

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda, 28 years old, is running a computer shop and provides computer services with her husband, earning about $12 per day. They have three children, 10, 9 and 3 years old, two of whom are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $25 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow for her father to feed and sell. She is staying in Thailand with her husband and visits her home sometimes on holidays. All of her children are living with her parents in Cambodia. To pay the loan she has to send money every month to her parents in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her father to feed and sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa americana de primera calidad, tanto para varones como para mujeres. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital y así adquirir dos fardos (son costales llenos de ropa) que contienen buena cantidad y variedad de ropa. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta será la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de Impro y la primera a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria sells American clothes that are of first-rate quality for men and women. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she acquire two bundles (sacks full of clothing) that are of good quality and contain a variety of items. Maria lives in a rented house in the District of Villa Copacabana in the city of La Paz.

This will be the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of American clothes.

loans.name: Pinissam

texts.fr:
Pinissam est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un étudiant et a un enfant de 6 ans scolarisé.  
Pinissam travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009.Elle fait la restauration de plats alimentaires accompagnée de la vente des boissons de brasserie  dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et à la brasserie de Lomé. 
Pinissam a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer sa restauration et la vente les boissons. 
Dans les prochaines années, Pinissam aimerait devenir une grossiste des boissons de brasserie et d’alimentation générale.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer au bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Pinissam is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a student and has a 6-year-old child attending school.

She has been working as a retail merchant since 2009. In her shop she sells food preparations accompanied by beverages. She gets her supplies from the great market and the brewery of Lomé.

Pinissam requested a second credit from WAGES to strengthen her activities preparing food and selling beverages.

In coming years, she would like to become a wholesaler of brewery and general food products. She said that with the profits she plans to contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: Buy beverages

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old and 2 of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Africana has a food production business in the Philippines. Africana requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Africana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou, 43, is a hard-working farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice crops. She is from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She is married with six children, four of whom are single and live together with her. Ou is able to earn in the neighborhood of $2.50 each day to cover her daily expenses. This is Ou’s second loan from Kiva partner, HKL, and she wants to use it to buy rice seeds and to pay for laborers to cultivate her rice crops. In the future, she hopes to support some of her children to at least finish the high school level. She is very happy and thankful for the loan given to her because it will allow her to invest in her farming business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay for laborers to cultivate her rice crops.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and four children. One child is working and three are still attending school. Because of the heavy life expenses and his children’s educational costs, Khalil was obliged to work hard to cover their needs.  Despite all that, he was thankful to have such a united and lovely family. 

He has twenty-five years experience in the field of agriculture until he opened his own agricultural products shop. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to pay his children’s university fees and expenses until graduation. In the future, he plans to open another business where his children can work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay his children’s university fees and expenses until graduation.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells snacks, like banana cue & pan cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virgincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients fro making snacks

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva nació en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Santiago y tiene 50 años edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Genoveva vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas.    
 
Genoveva se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Genoveva requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallinas.  

Genoveva es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Genoveva was born in the city of Cusco, district of Santiago, and is 50 years old. She is in a free union which has produced 4 children. At present, she lives in the historic city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.

Genoveva raises small livestock such as, for example, guinea pigs and hens. She has been in this business for several years and it is going well. She needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs and hens.

Genoveva belongs to the "Pillao" Communal Bank. This group is composed of 13 members, most of whom live in Cusco province, San Jeronimo district.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bales of shirts, T-shirts, blouses, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. Soun is in the business of selling firewood and lives in the Baray district. He is married with 2 children, one of whom is already married and no longer lives with the family. Besides selling firewood, Soun usually works alongside his wife to manage farming projects, especially in the rainy season.

This is Soun's first loan from HKL and Kiva. The purpose of the loan is to buy an additional buffalo to haul his firewood trailer. Soun feels very happy and thankful to the lenders who share their funds to help his family. He hopes that he’ll be to sustain his livelihood and improve his present business someday using the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo to haul his firewood trailer.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun is 57 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her children are still in her care. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Lun is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk threads to use for weaving more Krama (traditional Cambodian scarves) to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase silk threads to use for weaving more Krama (traditional scarves) to sell.

loans.name: Rufiminda

texts.en:
This is Rufiminda, 34, resident of Manila, Philippines. He is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rufiminda is a soft drinks dealer. She buys large quantities of soft drinks from soft drinks factory then sells it to different variety stores. Her ability to please people gives her more and loyal customers.  She earns a minimum of 2500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of DVD, speaker units and Soft drinks variants to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rufiminda hopes to expand her business in the coming years. She dreams to give all her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of soft drinks needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Hilda has been working hard to manage her vegetable business found in the market where her small store sells fresh vegetables.

To help expand her business, Hilda has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh vegetables that will attract more customers which will increase her sales. This will help Hilda to generate greater profits and provide her with enough basic needs for her family and also become self-reliant.

Hilda's plans in the future are to be able to start selling fresh bananas (matooke) as she believes it will increase her sales more thereby allowing her to have enough capital to start up another business. 

Hilda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh vegetables that will attract more customers which will increase her sales

loans.name: Jeniffer Carolina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita Jeniffer, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia medicina  en una universidad en Manta, este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. 
Jeniffer es una joven  que le gusta ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo  y salir adelante en sus estudios, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en la universidad donde estudia pues allí cuenta con muy buena clientela. De esta forma ella logra ganar sus recursos que le sirve para salir adelante ya que tiene muchos gastos en sus estudios y solo trabajando puede salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas que ella vende. Sus sueños son ser una gran medico.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina opened her store with only $60 of start-up capital. She sells basic foods including fruits and vegetables along with other snacks. She learned the trade from her husband who worked as a distributor in markets for a long time. 2 years ago he fell ill and is now paralyzed from the waist down. He tries to help Martina as much as he can in the market, but it is very difficult because he cannot even afford a wheel chair.

Martina is hoping to use this loan to make significant investments in new products. She wants to begin selling meats and eggs. Her home is in very poor conditions as it still made of wood and does not even have a concrete floor. She also has two children who she must provide for.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in chicken, beef and eggs to sell from her store

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a mother of two who was never able to complete her education and as a result, her elei printing and design business is the only source of income for her and her family.  Although her husband works, his income is very low.  Her elei business has enabled the family to afford some of the necessities of life that they were unable to afford before.

Elei printing takes a great deal of skill, as well as the knowing what the tastes of tourists and locals are.  Elei printing is a modern art that uses  tapa cloth and is one of Samoa's treasured and historical products.

Mele is applying for a loan of $650 from SPBDF to purchase additional materials to allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric and paints

loans.name: Qarya

texts.en:
Qarya lives in district 17 of Kabul Afghanistan she is uneducated and she like to help her husband and her husband is a metal worker he has a shop when he start  working he was face with difficulty  and his wife’s took her 3cycle group of loan and her husband bought new machines. Steal. And some deferent machines of metal working and make good monthly income for his family and now his wife’s wants to take anther loan to make anther shop and he is very happy that he can solve his problems.
Note; the picture featured in this business profile. Husband of entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.AFSG only doe’s group loans to woman.

loans.use: to buy extra things like machines and steal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost the inventory of his little store

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin is a 28 years old, single photographer. His photographic studio is located downtown Caacupe, he has been this job for more than 10 years. Currently, he has all the necessary elements to cover most of the events on the Cordillera department, which encompasses many towns and villages, Caacupe among them. The events he works are weddings, birthdays, baptisms, etc. He comments that he initially started with a single camera, with the more clients and work he had, Joaquin purchased two digital cameras to his already existent stock, thanks to the loans ‘Fundacion Paraguaya’ gave him before hand. Today, Joaquin has a broad client base and he affirms that photography is a very competitive niche and he needs to be up-to-date with the new digital equipment that are out in the market. In his short term projects he has to improve his photography studio and to get a computer and decorate the studio salon, he asks for a loan of $575.-

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Joaquín tiene 28 años, es soltero, y es fotógrafo; su estudio fotográfico está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé, éste oficio lo viene desarrollando desde hace más de 10 años, actualmente ya cuenta con todos los elementos necesarios para cubrir los más exigentes eventos en todo el departamento de la Cordillera que está comprendido de varias ciudades y pueblos, entre ellos Caacupe. Entre los eventos que asiste podemos citar casamientos, cumpleaños, bautismos, etc. Comenta que inicialmente empezó con una sola cámara fotográfica y a medida iba teniendo más trabajo y la clientela se volvía exigente, incorporó dos cámaras digitales a su ya existente stock de elementos de trabajo, esto gracias a los préstamos que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorgó anteriormente. Hoy día tiene formado su clientela y afirma que la fotografía es un rubro muy competitivo y se requiere estar actualizado constantemente con los nuevos equipos digitales que actualmente existen en el mercado. Esta dentro de sus proyectos a corto plazo la de mejorar su estudio fotográfico con la incorporación de una computadora y decorar su salón de estudio; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 575.-

loans.use: Para comprar una computadora

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier is a young man of 23 living with his family in the city of Caapucú. He is currently studying accounting and preparing to finish his final year of college. In school Javier has learned how to organize his principal life goals and how to work toward these goals.

From a very young age Javier began working with his father in the fields. Already, at this young age he was a livestock farmer. Thanks to this activity, he was able to generate his own income and with much sacrifice was able to use this money to begin his own business. Javier opened his store 2 years ago selling sports footwear, clothing and watches. He is well known in his city and has already established a regular client base.

Javier is requesting a loan so that he can buy more footwear and watches as requested by his store's clients. The increased revenue will allow Javier to purchase well-known brands and satisfy his clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy more footwear and watches

loans.name: Joaquim Ernesto

texts.pt:
Joaquim Ernesto M. is 36 years old; he lives in a social marriage and is the father of 3 sons. He lives in the neighborhood of Hulene, outside of the city of Maputo. Besides being a teacher at the local public school, he is also a tailor and runs his business out of his house. He joined the program in April of 2007 and because he joined so recently it is too soon to tell the progression of his business. He will borrow 10,000MT to invest in the bulk purchase of fabrics, threads, needles and other supplies needed to grow his business.

Translated by Camila, Kiva volunteer

Joaquim Ernesto M. tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 3 filhos.Vive no bairro Hulene, arredores da cidade de Maputo.É alfaiate e tem o seu negócio na sua residência, para além de ser professor numa escola comunitária situada no seu bairro. Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007, sendo ainda prematuro avaliar a sua evolução. Vai tomar 10.000MT para investir na compra em quantidade de tecidos, linhas, agulhas e outros materiais e utensílios necessários ao seu negócio.

loans.use:
Purchase of fabrics, threads, needles, etc.

Compra de tecidos,linhas, agulhas, etc

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Q., widow of Bautista, is the mother of 6 children whom she has been able to support through her ability to work with wool, to knit, and to fabricate jerseys as well as other items which she makes by hand in order to sell in the commercial centers of her area and the city of El Alto.

Thanks to the credit she has received from Pro Mujer, Teresa has been able to buy a sewing machine, with which she has increased her production and at the same time satisfied the demand that existed. However, this has still not been sufficient, since she has 6 children to feed and care for.

For this reason Teresa needs capital in order to increase her supply of raw material, and in this way elevate her production so that it will create a better income for maintaining herself and her 6 children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista, es madre de 6 hijos, a los cuales supo sacar adelante con su habilidad para realizar trabajos en lana, tejodos, chompas y otros, los que fabricaba a mano para poder luego vender en los principales comercios de su zona y de la ciudad de El Alto.

Gracias a los créditos de Pro Mujer, Teresa pudo coprar una máquina de tejido, con la cual ha incrementado su producción y del mismo modo a satisfecho la demanda que existía, pero aún no es suficiente, ya que son 6 hijos los que debe alimentar y cuidar.

Por tanto, Teresa precisa de capital para poder incrementar la compra de su materia prima, y de esta manera elevar su producción para que esto represente un mejor ingreso para el sustento de ella y de sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: To increase her supply of raw material and thereby elevate production.

loans.name: Najmi

texts.en:
Z. Najmi is 53 years old. She and her husband raised two children who are already married and living independently.

For more than 15 years Najmi has been selling the jewelry. Najmi is selling oriental style jewelry items. The earrings are very beautiful. People trust Najmi as she is very honest when assessing the prices and quality.

Najmi has been working with IMON for more than 7 years. She has proved herself as an honest and reliable borrower. She wants this loan of $500 to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new items of jewelry of the national style.

loans.name: Ocheng Iii A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of selling fresh food and is requesting a loan to become a food supplier. Rehema is 39 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 97000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her family. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more food and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Sauda N., Farida S., Jalia N., and Aisha T.. Sauda N. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy broiler chicks. Farida S. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add stock. Jalia N. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to stock more clothes. Aisha T. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock.

loans.use: To expand fresh food business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is married and has 2 children, they are 2 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver.

Maria del Rosario started her business 3 years ago, when a friend invited her to sell shoes from a catalogue. She now sells the shoes to friends and neighbors.

Thanks to her dedication and hard work, the business has developed well and it has allowed her to help her husband to buy a house, which they are currently paying off.

Her dream is to pay her house as she wants to leave her children a state of their own.

The loan she requests is to buy more merchandise for the pending orders she already has. With your help, Rosario will be able to continue improving her business and she will ultimately pay her house as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Rosario es casada y tiene 2 niños uno de 2 años y otro de 4 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Debido a la necesidad que tenia de ayudar a su marido y poder obtener una casa propia para su familia gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo esta meta se vio lograda y actualmente la esta pagando ya que su deseo es poder formar un patrimonio para sus hijos, tiene 3 años vendiendo calzado por catalogo con amistades y vecinos este negocio lo inicio por invitación de una amiga.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir los pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda rosario podrá seguir pagando su casa. .

loans.use: To buy more shoes in order to cover her pending orders

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
M. Nana is married and has two children. She prepares food for sale. The name of the food she prepares is etsew and it is commonly eaten by a tribe known as the Fante in the central and western region of Ghana. Business is doing very well and she plans increasing production.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy food supplies for her food production.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas has sold school equipment, but since 3 years ago she has been selling cebiche (a traditional Peruvian seafood dish) in the market near her house.

She rises at 5 in the morning to prepare the cebiche. At 9 o'clock she goes to the market and she takes out her wagon, where she sells until 2 in the afternoon.

The loan that she has requested will serve as capital for her food business. But Leonidas would like to have her own position in the market to be able to sell fruits, and to leave the sale of cebiche.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonidas vendía útiles escolares, pero desde hace 3 años vende cebiche en el mercado cerca de su casa.

Ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana a preparar el cebiche. A las 9 va al mercado y saca su carreta, donde vende hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido como capital para su negocio de comida. Pero a Leonidas le gustaría tener un puesto propio en el mercado para poder vender frutas, y dejar la venta de cebiche.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making cebiche for sale in the market.

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try K. is a vegetable seller in Kandalleu Village, Kandal Province. K. is responsible for selling the crops at her local market. Her husband grows the crops that K. sells, including cabbage and other popular Cambodian vegetables. They earn around $3 per day. They work very hard every day. Due to a recent increase in her family’s expenses. Try K. needs to expand her business to increase her family income. 

K. is requesting a loan of $400 to use for her farming business. She will use the majority of the loan to purchase seeds for her husband to plant. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase petrol for their pumping machine. The pumping machine allows them to transfer water between plots of land for irrigation.

loans.use: To use for her farming business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the sale of drinks. She learned this business from her aunty. She started her own business in 2006. She needs the loan amount of US$ 350 to buy more drinks for sale to her customers. She expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Yeny Mercedes

texts.es:
Yeny is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children. She has been making mattresses out of wool and straw over the past 8 years. Yeny and her husband share responsabilities. The furniture is made during the week and it's sold on weekends. Every weekend, she goes out to sell her mattresses in the city of Huancayo to all the furniture stores around the city. She likes to do so because it gives her a chance to see the whole process from start to finish. In order to make these mattresses, you need a few of the key materials such as straw from wheat, rice and plenty of wool which she purchases in fabric stores. She uses needles of different sizes and diameters, thread, candle wick to sew the fabric in place. The hardest part is to obtain all of these materials when they're not in season. This is precisely why Yeny buys as much material as possible and in bulk so that she can store it and be available whenever she needs it.

Yenny's motivation are her kids so that they can finish school. She's requesting this loan so that she can purchase more material. Her goal is to be a mayor distributor and for that she will need a lot of clients.

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Yeny tiene 42 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la fabricación de colchones a base de lana y paja, todos los días, ella y su esposo comparten roles, los fines de semana ella sale a la ciudad de Huancayo para vender sus colchones a las tiendas que venden muebles, de esa manera Yeny puede ver el fruto de la ardua labor que realizó durante la semana. Para fabricar estos colchones se abastece de los materiales necesarios, tales como la paja de trigo, arroz y retazos de lana que compra en las empresas que fabrican frazadas, también las telas que le servirán para darle la presentación a los colchones, las herramientas que utiliza son las agujas de diferentes diámetros y medidas, así como pabilo e hilo para unir las costuras que han de hacerse, la dificultad radica en obtener los materiales, sobre todo cuando no es época, por eso que Yeny tiene que abastecerse de ellos con anticipación. Yeny se esfuerza por sus hijos, para que sigan superándose a través del estudio. Solicita este préstamo que invertirá en la compra de los materiales que requiere para su producción, ella se ha puesto como meta ser una distribuidora mayorista de colchones, para lo cual se asociará con algunas personas más.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make mattresses

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela es propietaria de dos motocarros, adicionalmente  se dedica  a la venta de comida por las noches, tiene dos hijos menores. Su esposo Sergio es el chofer de uno de los motocarros y es quien se dedica al cuidado de las motos. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, y mejorar su negocio de venta de comida,  para posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida cómodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Mayela owns two motorcycles and also dedicates herself to selling food in the evenings. She has two young sons. Her husband Sergio drives one of the motorcycles and also takes care of their maintenance. The money she is requesting will be used to maintain the motorcycles and repair Sergio's tools and to improve Mayela's business of selling food so that she can build a kiosk to sell her food comfortably. Support this mother who with effort and dedication keeps working arduously to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of two motorcycles and investment in food selling business.

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La señora Darling S. es una esforzada dama qeu se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde es originaria.

Esta dama es madre soltera y con dos hijos en obligación de mantener y por esta razón es que se desempeña grandemente en su negocio para suplir las necesidades de su hogar.

Hoy en día a la señora Darling le urge adquirir la carne para comercializarla y es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar la carne y así comercializarla en su negocio.
texts.en:
Darling S. is a hardworking woman who sells products made from pork in the central market of Chinandega, the city where she was born. This woman is a single mother with two children to support. This is reason why she works so hard at her business in order to provide the necessities for her home. Today Darling urgently needs to buy meat to sell; for this reason she looks for help from Ceprodel to obtain a loan with which she can buy meat for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, married, lives in the orderly community of Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela and chooses a welding shop business as their source of income. Brenda and her husband work hard in order to earn enough money to provide for their family’s needs and support their six children’s education. The members of the family happily take part in the operation of their machine/welding shop.

They also receive orders for steel trusses, metal windows and other related metal products.  Brenda is requesting additional capital amounting to Php7, 000 to be used in purchasing a grinding machine, machine tools and welding rods which are all necessary to the growth of their business because these will meet their customers’ expectations in terms of quality.

She expects that the business growth that they will achieve by borrowing additional capital will enable her to help her husband and send all of their children to school and finish college.

loans.use: purchase tools, machine, etc.

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en:
Yalchin M. is a 31-year-old man who sells different kind of goods in a rented store in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He is married and has 2 adorable daughters. He started his business in 2000 and since that time he has a permanent and single income that his store brings in monthly.

Yalchin's dream is to provide his daughters with an excellent education. With this wish in his heart, he starts his working day early in the morning and finishes late at night. He would like to increase his income and one day build his own store. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD.

loans.use: purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en: S. Nuriniso applied to MicroInvest for the first time in 2008 when she asked for a business development loan to open a trade outlet. Today she trades in the local bazaar in the new trade outlet for mens wear. Nuriniso has been engaged in business for 10 years and she is a skilled trader. Nuriniso brings her wares for herself from Uzbekistan and Istaravshan. She has good taste so a lot of repeat customers come to buy her assortment. Nuriniso applies the KIVA to ask the financial support of her existing business with a the loan of 1400 STJ for 1 month to import seasonal wear. Nuriniso thanks KIVA for its support of the low-income entrepreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: to import seasonal wear

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es: Doña Josefa Maritza M. tiene 51 años, está casada, y tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica Doña Josefa es la venta de carne de res y cerdo. Hace veinte años que tiene este negocio, y durante los primeros cinco anos, ella tuvo muchos problemas con mantener una base consistente de clientes. Con suerte, la ubicación del negocio está en un puesto de venta en el mercadito de Sutiaba en León, donde se experimenta mucho tráfico. La idea de establecer este negocio ocurrió porque su esposo había quedado desempleado, y entre los dos decidieron apoyarse y procurar enfrentar lo que les estaba aconteciendo. Además, Doña Josefa quiso establecer este negocio porque usualmente los mercadores no ofrecen carne de buena calidad y ella quería ser una de las pocas lo que hiciera. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado a la compra de más carne y ella desea obtener un mayor margen de ganancias al momento de realizar la venta de su producto. Al final, ella sueña con un hermoso puesto de ventas que le genere los ingresos necesarios para poder construir una vivienda en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Josefa Maritza M. is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. The economic activity that Josefa carries out is the sale of beef and pork. She has had this business for the past 20 years, and during the first 5 years she faced many problems maintaining a consistent client base. With luck, the location of her business is in a stall in the small market of Sutiaba in León, where there is much foot traffic. The idea of establishing this business arose because her husband had become unemployed, and between the two they decided to support one another and try to confront what was happening. Moreover, Josefa wanted to establish this business because usually the merchants didn’t offer good quality meat and she wanted to be one of the few that did. The loan will be used for work capital destined for the purchase of more meat and she wishes to obtain a higher earnings margin when she sells her product. In the end, she wishes to have a beautiful stall that generates the necessary income to be able to build a house in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital destined for the purchase of more meat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 44 años, cuatro hijos de 28, 26,24, y  4 años, los mayores trabajan.
Maria y su esposo tienen un negocio de cerrajería se llama “Julio Ramos” que funciona en su casa,  ella ayuda alijar pinta.
Desde que esta en Finca ha recibido ayuda, a través de las charlas aprendió como manejar mejor su negocio, aprendió a ser comunicativa expresar sus ideas, por que era muy tímida. 
Necesita un crédito de 2200 soles para comprar fieros, soldaduras, pinturas. 
El sueño de Maria es que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Jesús de Praga". Maria lives with her husband. She is 44 years old and she has four children that are 28, 26, 24 and 4 years old. Her two oldest children work. Maria and her husband own a locksmith business. It is called "Julio Ramos" and they run it our of their house. Since she has been in the group Finca she has received help with her business. At the lectures she has learned how to run her business better and also how to express her ideas and to communicate better. She was very shy before. She needs a loan of $675 (2,200 Soles) to be able to purchase paints, metals and other welding materials for her business. Maria dreams that her business will prosper.

(Translated by Justin of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of $675 (2,200 Soles) to be able to purchase paints, metals and other welding materials for her business.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es: Melchor es una persona alegre y responsable, sobre todo con su rol de padre, pues junto a su pareja trabajan arduamente para satisfacer las necesidades de su última hija, quien tiene muchos anhelos de estudiar. Esta familia vive en una pequeña casa construida con mucho esfuerzo desde hace 10 años. Sus ganancias como músico, hace 20 años, le sirvieron para mantener a sus cinco hijos mayores, quienes ya son independientes, más ahora para cumplir los sueños de su menor hija tiene que trabajar el doble, pues la situación económica no es igual que antes y le obligó a buscar nuevas alternativas de trabajo. Desde entonces, por las mañanas se dedica al reciclaje y en las tardes ayuda a su esposa en la atención de su bodega, la cual viene funcionando desde hace cuatro años y hasta ahora ha ido creciendo notablemente, pues en sus inicios solo vendía algunas bebidas, pero ahora tiene gran variedad de productos y sus vecinos están acostumbrados a realizar sus compras en la tienda de don Melchor. Sus más próximos anhelos es techar su casa para ampliar su tienda y ambientarla con nuevos exhibidores que llamen la atención de las personas. Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene Melchor con MFP y el tiempo de permanencia le sirvió para adquirir nuevas técnicas de negocio y conocer a las personas de su grupo con quienes comparte momentos gratos de reunión. Desea invertir 1500 soles en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de reciclaje, así como aumentar el capital de inversión para su tienda.
texts.en:
Melchor is a happy and responsible man, especially in his role as a father. Together with his wife, they work diligently to take care of the needs of their youngest daughter, who has dreams of studying. This family lives in a little house built with a lot of effort 10 years ago. His earnings as a musician, which he has done for 20 years, helped him take care of his five older children, who are now all grown up. But now, to be able to fulfill the dreams of his youngest daughter, he has to work double since the economic situation is not as good as before, which means he has to seek out other employment alternatives.

In the mornings, he works at recycling and in the afternoons he helps his wife run their store, which has been in business for four years and has grown considerably up until now. At the beginning they only sold drinks, but they now have a variety of products and their neighbors have grown accustomed to buying in Mr. Melchor's store. Their next dream is to put a roof on their house to be able to create more space for their store, and install new display cases that will call the attention of their customers.

This is the 13th loan Melchor will have with MFP, and his longstanding status has helped him acquire new business techniques and get to know the people in his group, with whom he shares pleasant moments in their meetings.

He would like to invest 1500 soles in the purchase of merchandise for his recycling business, which will in turn increase the available capital to invest in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to his merchandise

loans.name: Teutele

texts.en: Teutele P. M., 29, is married with 3 children. She has five years of experience in the traditional Samoan printing of fabric, called elei. She sells to the village people and also the public six days per week. This is her second loan for 1500 with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala. Teutele plans to do some home renovations with this money and to purchase items she needs to improve her business. SPBD loans are Teutele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cement, timber, iron roofing for home repairs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo menor de 18 años, ya que uno de los mayores se fue a trabajar a la Argentina y el otro ya está independizado. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas un pequeño quiosco que tiene fuera de su casa, esto en la localidad de Chancay, a una hora y media de Lima, donde viene realizando este negocio desde hace ya varios años para cubrir los gastos económicos de su hogar. Debido a que ya los gastos en su casa han bajado, por la salida de sus hijos, quieren invertir en al compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta actividad les ha significado a Antonio y a su esposa (juntos en la foto) mucho sacrificio y dedicación, trabajando durante todo el día, pero felizmente ambos son muy unidos y persistentes, sabiendo que juntos podrán lograr todas sus metas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de golosinas para implementar mejor su quiosco.
texts.en:
Antonio, 56, lives with his wife and his youngest son who is 18. One of his children went to work in Argentina. Another child is living independently. He sells sweets in a small kiosk outside of their house. It is in Chancay, which is an hour and a half from Lima. They have had this business for several years to pay for household expenses. Since their household expenses have decreased with two children leaving, they want to buy more sweets to increase their earnings. This business has required a lot of sacrifice and dedication from Antonio and his wife (together in the photo). They work all day, but happily they are very united and persistent. They know that together than can achieve their goals. This is his first loan with Midrofinanzas Prisma. He promises to be very punctual with all of his payments. With the loan he will buy a large quantity of sweets to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Elfrida owns a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Maendeleo 'A' group loan (Group code 2014).  Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Elfrida is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Veronica. Veronica has her own small business selling hens and eggs in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock for her shop.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy V. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Juvy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a gardening business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over seven  years and earns approximately PHP5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of PHP14,900 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juvy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es:
GULNARA R. D. V. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS” vive en la Av. Víctor Andrés BelaunD. del distrito D. CampoverD., en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 55 años D. edad, 4 hijos mayores y su pareja es empleado D. una empresa maderera.

Se inició en el negocio D. la costura, y el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas e hilos, para hacer sabanas y vender a sus amigos y vecinos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. repuestos para autos ya que tiene un taller donD. ofrece el servicio D. reparación D. autos.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy muy contenta con esta ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Gulnara R. D. V. is a member of the "Las Nazarenas" Village Bank and lives on Victor Andres BelaunD. Street on CampoverD. District in the city of Pucallpa. She is 55 years old and has four adult children; her husband works for a lumber company. Gulnara first started out as a seamstress, and used her first loan of 300 soles to buy fabric and thread to make sheets to sell to her friends and neighbors. With this loan of 2,000 soles, Gulnara will buy replacement car parts, since she also has an auto repair shop. "Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports a great number of families with small loans that allow women in this area to begin or improve their businesses, and I'm very happy with this help," Gulnara says.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement car parts

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business in which she plants and harvests corn and coconut for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
From day to day, Oeu S. goes about buying essential ingredients, such as sugar, floor, banana and oil, that she uses to make grilled bananas. She works from her home and sells for a profit. Oeu S. is a humble 54-year-old villager. She is a mother blessed with seven children: five are single and two are married and living independently. Five of her children are employed in the field doing various work; while her husband works in construction.

Oeu S. will be using her loan to help sustain her daughter’s silk skirt business. That business is profitable and is helping to meet the family’s daily living expenses.

loans.use: To help sustain a silk skirt business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Natividad, ella vive en el barrio de collasuyo, en ucchullo grande, a unos 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  53 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene  8 hijos (los dos últimos de 14 y 8 años), ella alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar, con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y ella misma cocina y se encarga de administrar todo, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en mejorar su restaurante, para así poder llegara a mas personas.

Nuestra socia se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is Ms. Natividad. She lives in the Collasuyo neighborhood in Ucchullo Grande which is about 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. Natividad is 53 years old, is a common-law wife and has 8 children (the youngest are 14 and 8 years old). She alternates between tending to different household activities, a retail business, and a small restaurant which she cooks for and runs herself. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in improving her restaurant in order to then be able to serve more people. Natividad is committed to paying back her debt in the established term.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en: Saeda is a 40 year old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a food market in her town since 2008. Today, Saeda is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
V. is an older widowed woman and is a mother blessed with six children who are teenagers. Four of them are employed: two daughters are garment workers and two sons are blacksmiths. V. currently retails various vegetables that she buys in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier at the market.

V. is looking for a loan for her sons to use as capital to purchase additional ferrous metal for their blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ferrous metal for her sons' blacksmith business

loans.name: Si Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Si Thai U. lives Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed to grow on the field. In order to solve this problem, she decided to request for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Phang Sarem, is a construction worker. Mrs. Si Thai U. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Jesus Te Amo Group

texts.es:
María S.  de 42 años muy temprano se levanta los días martes y viernes para vender su  mercadería, es decir,  verduras en la zona de Alto Lima,  está con su grupo  aproximadamente 2 años,  recuerda que con su primer préstamo compró mercadería para emprender su negocio, ahora necesita un poco más ya que su venta ha incrementado porque ha conseguido clientes que le piden mayores productos, es así que necesita el préstamo para seguir comprando  mercadería como alverja y zanahoria, ella compra su mercadería de la Ceja ciudad de El Alto.
María es madre de 3 niños a quienes les hace seguimiento en sus labores escolares.
