Maria pertenece al grupo Jesús te Ama que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, sus compañeras también tiene sus negocios como la venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de juguetes, bolsas plásticas, muebles, chocolate, ropa y costura de pollera (falda).
Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
María S. is 42. She gets up very early on Tuesdays and Fridays to sell her merchandise, vegetables, in the Alto Lima region. She has been in her group for approximately two years. She remembers that she used her first loan to buy merchandise to start her business. Now she needs a little more because her sales have increased. She has obtained customers who ask her for more products. That is why she needs a loan to be able to keep buying merchandise like peas and carrots. She buys her merchandise in the city of Ceja in El Alto. María has three children who are in school. María belongs to the Jesús te Ama Group, which is part of the German Busch community center. Her colleagues also have businesses like selling “chuño” (dried potato), selling toys, plastic bags, furniture, chocolate, clothing, and making “polleras” (skirts). All of them need a loan to buy merchandise or raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Wengielou

texts.en:
A high school graduate, 19 years old and married, Wengielou T. is a retailer of goods in her general store at their village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is married to Reybell T., a farmer. They are gifted with one child named Anna Mae, five months old. As she dreams of getting an education, pursuing her college studies, and having a good future, Wengielou also dreams this for her child. She will try to do her best to fulfill these dreams for her child. During her time getting her education, she has lots of wishes.

Being a loving mother, Wengilou’s dreams now are for her child. She wants her child to finish her education and have a good future. Her business is the key to achieving it all. She will manage her business well and do her best to improve it. She wants to borrow the amount of Php 5,000 for additional capital to improve her store business.

loans.use: additional capital to improve her store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old, married and has three children. She sells yams on the riverbank and has been in business for two years. She is a faithful and a committed LAPO client. The profit from this trade enables her to assist her husband in providing for the needs of the family. 

She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase yams in bulk as this attracts sales discounts for her, thereby increasing her profit. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn M. lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and she does not have enough money to pay for plowing. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing.

Her husband, Mr. Nhang Nhorn (pictured on the right), is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Soeurn M. is 55 years old and the mother of six children; two are employed in a garment factory, two are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining child stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pay for plowing

loans.name: Geovana

texts.es:
La señorita Geovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Tiene estudios superiores y cuenta con una tienda de fotocopiado.
Geovana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar papel y toner para de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es ser empresaria.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Geovana has been a member of the “Great Power” cooperative bank for 2 years, located in the Ilave district of Collao, Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. She completed her secondary education, and has a photocopy store. Geovana tells us that her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement augmented her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 2,000.00 soles to buy paper and toner, in order to help her business grow. Her future dream is to be a businesswoman. The things she enjoys most about being part of a cooperative bank are the punctuality and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper and toner.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie BASSENE est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE depuis le 19 mai 2007 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marie B., aged 46, is married and the mother of five children who attend school. She has been a member of the village bank of Lyndiane since May 19, 2007 and was granted five loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. Marie participates in the payment of school fees for her children and supports her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk C. is 41 years old and lives in Royak village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and, since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she is applying for 800,000 Riel from AMK to buy more piglets to raise and pig food.

Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Nov, is shown on the right in the photo. He is a worker in the rice-mill factory in the local village and is able to earn a small salary to support his family’s living. The couple have four children, one of whom is an employee in the garment factory and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum Y., age 48, is an internal staff member in the organization, earning a salary of $100 per month. She currently lives with other family members in a wooden house located on a commune in the province of Battambang. She is married with three school-aged kids, who are dependent on their parent’s income. Sum Y.’s husband is the chief provider for the family. He is a professional Khmer lecturer for a local public class. 

Sum Y. and her husband face difficulties travelling to work or anywhere else because they do not have a vehicle. To solve this problem, Sum Y. is applying for a loan to add to her personal money in order to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: God's Will Business Group

texts.en:
'God’s Will Business' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Hanachor S..  He is 42 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 6 months and 3 years old.  Hanachor is a high school graduate but could not continue his education through college due to a lack of financial support.

Hanachor sells goods such as candles, batteries, sugar and bread.  He buys his goods wholesale and sells retail in a shop to residents of his community in Paynesville, Liberia. He has been running this business for 3 years and hopes to grow his business.  Hanachor started out selling his goods out of a wheelbarrow, but now operates from a shop.

Hanachor interacts well with his customers, which encourages them to continue buying from him.  He will use this loan to purchase more candles, batteries, sugar and bread.  He dearly hopes that his children will remain in good health and that he can afford medical attention for them if needed.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hanachor is the one holding the sign.  Jartu J. is in the inset at lower right.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as candles, batteries, sugar and bread for resale

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 51 years old, married with four children. He hopes to give his children quality education. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He sells chemicals and groceries at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more groceries and chemicals to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and chemicals to sell

loans.name: Sergio Pedro

texts.pt:
Sérgio Pedro W. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 25 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 anos e 6 meses de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha com os seus pais devido a Guerra de desestabilização. Mais tarde iniciou seu próprio lar e seu próprio negoceia, possui 2 parcelas de agricultura que usa para produzir hortícolas para venda. Consegue um rendimento de cerca 2.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, janelas, cimento e outros).  
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua residência e ampliar as suas áreas de cultivo.
texts.en:
Sérgio Pedro W. was born in Massinga, Inhambane Province, south of Mozambique. He is 25 years old, married and the father of two children aged 5 and 6 months, neither one of them go to school yet. He dropped school on 10th grade due to lack of financial support. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else besides his family. He left Inhambane to the Namaacha District with his parents during the War of Destabilization. Later on he build his house and started his business. He owns some land that he uses to plant vegetables to sell. He makes around U$80 per month and uses the money to support his household and save some in a bank account. He never tood loans in other banks and heard of Hluvuku through a neighbor that's also a client. This is Sergio's first loan and he's asking for U$475 to buy construction supplies (doors, windows, cement and others). He is committed to pay the loan back on time so he can take other loans in the future, in order to keep improving his house and his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela M. C., es casada y con sus dos hijos pequeños habita en el Populoso Barrio de Los Ríos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella es agricultora desde hace más de 17 años.

Dentro de las prioridades que tienen para el hogar esta la reparación de la entrada de su casa, debido a que con la llegada del invierno se deterioro y por el momento no les brinda una seguridad para sus pequeños hijos, dentro de los principales problemas que ha tenido con las tierras ha sido la sequía en la zona que ha bajado en un 40% la producción trimestral, dentro de los cambios a futuro, se tienen trazado para el cultivo esta el cambio de las áreas que  no produzcan y cultivar arboles que den sombra, solicita un préstamo para la mejoría continua de los campos en la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas e insumos vegetativos , ella espera que este apoyo económico le aporte mejores condiciones de siembra y con esto le favorezca económicamente para invertir en futuros proyectos que tenga la familia, tales como la reparación de la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafaela M. C. is married and lives with her two small children in the densely-populated Los Ríos neighborhood; her husband is a fruit and vegetable merchant and she has been a farmer for over 17 years. Among the priorities they have for their home is repairing its entrance because winter damaged it and they currently lack proper security for their children. Among the main problems she has had with her farmlands is the drought that has caused a 40% reduction in production this quarter. For the future, plans are in place to replace crops in unproductive areas with shade trees. She is asking for funding for soil maintenance; she needs to buy supplies like, fertilizers, fungicides and other farm supplies. She hopes this financial help will help provide better growing conditions so that she will be benefited financially in order to be able to invest in future projects for the family, like repairing their home’s façade.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ramya

texts.en:
Ramya  is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and son in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. Her son and husband  help her  in managing a coir business, which consists of weaving the fibers from coconut shells into household products such as floor mats.  She uses the income from the family business to help cover daily living expenses. They have managed this business for six years now. 

Ramya is known as a very honest and hard-working woman who is willing to help others in her community when needed. Ramya has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy coir.

Thank you very much for taking the time to consider supporting this loan!

loans.use: to purchase coir to make woven products for sale

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen E. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business and in a buy-and-sell rice business. She lives in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their nine-year-old child.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard both in her general store and in her rice business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $420.

Aileen is borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can expand her general store and her rice businesses. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Aileen aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
Luis de 30 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (con varios cerros y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), su esposa es ama de casa tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años. Cuando Luis era pequeño el papa tenia una carnicería y todos sus hermanos trabajaban con el. Como era un negocio familiar todos aprendieron administrar la carnicería, cuando crecieron todos sus hermanos invirtieron sus ahorros en carnes para vender, incluyéndolo a el.

 Ahora la carnicería es su primer ingreso para su familia, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00pm, vende la libra de carne a $ 2.20, chancho a $ 2.00,etc. Pero para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos el quiere construir mejor su casa comprando hierro y cemento para la construcción. 

En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas cortadoras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 30, and he lives in the Primavera de Duran (an area with some hills and lakes that still show signs of ecological dissolution) with his wife, who works at home, and their two children, 8 and 3. When Luis was young, his father had a butcher shop and all the sisters and brothers worked there. Since it was a family business, they all learned how to manage a it. When they all grew up, they, including Luis, invested their savings in meat to sell. Now the butcher shop is the main income for his family. He works there from 7 am until 8 pm, selling beef by the pound at $2.20, pork at $2.00. But to give a better life to his children he wants to build his house better, buying iron and cement for the construction. In the future we wants to buy meat cutting machines for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, cement

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a young man who is 27 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have two children aged 5 and 1 years old. He is the head of the family and thus in charge of the welfare of the four people he lives with. He has a motorcycle for transport business and also deals in selling local brew to make family ends meet. He says he would like to buy motorcycles for the transport business. He lives in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is to use the loan to purchase more local brew for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase local brew for reselling.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is married and has seven children. Six of her children are in school; the youngest has not yet started school.

Immaculee sells cow and goat hides.  She collects them in the neighborhood and sells them to people from the city.  Her clients treat the hides and either export them or sell them to people who make leather products, such as sandals, belts, etc. She has done this business for five years and she is proud of it. 

With this loan, she plans to buy more hides in order to make more profits. She has been selling 30 hides per day and hopes to increase her sales to 80 hides per day.If all goes well, with the profits, she hopes to expand her business even more by buying more hides.

loans.use: Buying more hides in order to make more profits

loans.name: Lucinda Marlena

texts.es: Lucinda tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende diferentes artículos como son abarrotes, verduras y frutas. Empezo vendiendo condimentos, al pasar los años su negocio ha crecido y eso gracias a los prestamos de Edaprospo. Ella vende en un pequeño mercado por donde vive, pero su objetivo es aperturar un negocio en casa, Las ganancias que obtiene la deriva para los gastos en casa. Su objetivo es terminar sus estudios secundarios. Y apoyar a toda su familia. Lucinda agradece a Edaprospo y Kiva por los prestamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Lucinda has a place in the market where she sells different items such as groceries, vegetables and fruits. She started out selling condiments, and over the years her business has grown, thanks to loans from Edaprospo. She sells in a little market near where she lives, but her goal is to open a store in her house. The profits she is making are going towards the expenses for her house. Her objective is to complete her secondary schooling, and to help her entire family. Lucinda is very grateful to Edaprospo for the loans she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and raw materials

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie B. is 29 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. She lived in the village of Sulipat, Calamba. To make a living, Emie owns and operates a general store selling household items in the local community. Out of this activity she's able to earn a monthly net income of 4000.00. She has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years.

In 2008, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Emie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Emie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a resident of Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city and the capital of Punjab province. 

She is thirty-seven years old and lives in a small house with her family. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both are illiterate and her son has a fruit-selling business. 

Suraiya supports her family by making and selling artificial flowers. She is very skillful in her art and earns a good income every month. Her husband sells seasonal fruits and works in the fruit market.  

Suraiya’s husband wants to increase his income by improving his fruit selling business for which he needs investment. Therefore, Suraiya has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her husband’s fruit selling business. She is confident that her husband will make positive use of the loan money and will be able to increase his income. 

Suraiya’s daughter is getting older and she wants to marry her within a year. She hopes that increased profits will help her do so. 

Suraiya is in her 4th loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Asasah. In her previous years of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase fruits for reselling

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida P. is a widow who lives in Park Kambiakeke, Barangay Guiwanon, Bantayan, Cebu City.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures. She has a crab meat vending business, a dried fish vending business and she also operates a sari-sari (general) store. 

Nida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past nineteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $554, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family and her businesses and for the education of their future children. Nida P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy D. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by pig fattening, buying and selling rice and farming. She lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000. Percy is borrowing PHP10,000 so that she can purchase more goods to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Percy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose M. is 28 years old, married and has four children. Her eldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of Kiva in the Philippines, to have capital to start a business. Now she is so proud that she became a member of ASHI because, aside from now being financially independent from her husband’s income, her confidence has improved as a consequence of attending weekly meetings and meeting different people. Today she is one proud mother because her earnings have helped pay for their daily expenses and the allowances of their children for going to school. Her husband is also happy because they were able to renovate their house.

This time, Mary Rose is applying for additional capital of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for her variety store. She will buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers, as well as soft drinks and assorted grocery products. Her business plan is to earn more and increase her capital so she can have more stock to sell and earn more profit. Since rice is in demand by her customers, she wishes to increase the volume of her stock. All her goals will be achieved if ASHI and Kiva will give their complete support and trust in her capability to manage her business. In return, she will insure diligence in performing her tasks as a member and the mother of her children. Her husband and children will always serve as her inspiration to do her best in managing the business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, soft drinks and assorted grocery products

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta T. habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est âgée  de 46 ans. Elle  est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 14 et 28 ans. Madame T. a démarré  l’activité de commerce depuis plus de six ans maintenant. Elle l’a choisi par passion mais aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son activité de commerce est très diversifiée car en même temps qu’elle vend des tissus, draps, thioup  elle s’active aussi dans le petit commerce en vendant des bonbons et du petit déjeuner.  Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé trois prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs qui sera destiné à renforcer son fond de commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices avec ce financement pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle souhaite vivement accroitre son activité de commerce et disposer d’un grand magasin de tissus dans le futur.
texts.en: Mrs. Bineta T. lives in the town of Yoff. She is 46 years old, married and mother to seven children, whose ages range from 14 to 28 years old. Mrs. T. began her commercial activity more than six years ago. She chose it because she liked it, but also because she was anxious to procure an income which would allow her to improve her family's living conditions. Her business is very diversified, since while she sells fabric, sheets and "thioups" (dyed pieces of fabric), she also sells sweets and breakfasts. She has been a shareholder member of the Yoff bank since February 2005 and has already paid back three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs which will be used to strengthen her business. Her goal is to increase her profits with this loan in order to improve her family's living conditions. She is very keen to expand her business and to have a large fabric shop in the future.

loans.use: To boost working capital

loans.name: Victoria De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Victoria de la Concepcion M. N. es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Chinandega con quien tenemos convenios con deducciones de salarios quincenales, es casada tiene 2 hijos en edades escolares trabaja con CEPRODEL desde el 2007 y ha obtenido 5 creditos.

Doña Victoria M. N. Solicito credito para ponerse al dia con pagos de mensualidades de la Universidad ya que de no estar al dia no le permitirian hacer examenes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a hardworking resident of the town of Chinandega. Chinandega has an arrangement with CEPRODEL where they can deduct loan payments every fifteen days from a person’s salary. Mrs. Victoria is married with two school-aged children. She has worked with CEPRODEL since 2007 and has had five loans with them.
Mrs. Victoria is asking for this loan in order to make monthly payments to the university. If she is not up to date on her payments, they will not let her take her exams.

loans.use: Personal expenses (education)

loans.name: Aracelis Del Socorro

texts.es: Aracelis Del Socorro tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Este negocio se lo enseñaron sus padres la comercialización de artesanía es un negocio al que se dedican las personas de pocos recursos en la comarca de tololapa. Está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde muchos de sus vecinos compran sus diferentes productos y también ella los vende de manera ambulante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima necesaria y vender la artesanía ya que se acerca una muy buena temporada. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y vender a otros departamentos.
texts.en: Aracelis Del Socorro is 26 years old and her business activity is selling merchandise.  She has had her business for more than 4 years.  Her parents taught her the business.  Selling handicrafts is a common business activity amongst people with few means of support in the district of Tololapa.  Aracelis' business is located in her home where many neighbors come to buy her different products.  She also sells her products itinerantly.  She is requesting this loan to buy necessary raw materials and sell her handicrafts since a very good season is approaching.  She dreams of expanding her business and selling in other departments.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la señora Gloria de Jesus C. I. tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija, ambas viven en el Barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Gloria se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de arreglos florales artificiales de todos tamaños, coronas, presentaciones de boda, para 15 años etc. 
su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome.
Gloria atiende en su negocio de lunes a domingo y tiene una gran demanda de clientes ya que es una mujer detallista y hace muy bien su trabajo.
Gloria utilizara el credito para comprar los materiales para la fabricacion de sus arreglos, tiene muchos pedidos por la epoca navideña.
texts.en:
Gloria de Jesus C. I. is 38 years old, is single, and has one daughter. She and her daughter live in the Suyapa neighborhood of the city of Nacaome.

Gloria’s business is the making and sales of artificial flower arrangements. She makes all sizes including crowns, and designs for weddings and 15th birthday celebrations. Her business is located in the municipal market of Nacaome and Gloria is there from Monday to Sunday. There is a great demand for her work as she is very skilled and detail-oriented.

This loan will be used to purchase raw materials for making flower arrangements. Gloria has many orders for the Christmas season.

loans.use: buy materials for making flower arrangements

loans.name: Julia Maya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Julia, tiene 40 años de edad, está separada pero de  esa relación  tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace un año y le gusta porque  los intereses son bajos en relación a los otros Bancos.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos,  perfumería y accesorios de damas). Ella tiene un grupo de vendedoras a su cargo, Trabaja cuatro días a la semana unas tres horas por día. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y  bisutería, además de estos productos también vende ropa por catalogo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar  productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería y otros productos. Su sueño es  ser directora de Yanbal.
texts.en: In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos Stadium, the members of the Virgen de Monserrate Community Bank meet every fifteen days. Here we meet Mrs. Julia. She is 40 years old and separated, but has two children ages 17 and 18 from this relationship. The children are in school and university. Julia has been part of the Community Bank for one year and she likes it because the interest rates are low compared to the other Banks. She is a merchant. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women´s accessories). She has a group of sellers under her. She works four days a week, three hours a day. The products that she sells the most are perfume and costume jewelry. She also sells clothing through a catalogue. This loan is to buy products such as- creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and other products. Her dream is to be the head of Yanbal.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and other Yambal products.

loans.name: Ann Kaluki

texts.en:
Ann Kaluki, aged 52, has been running a boutique for the last two years. She is married to Andrew, aged 57, and together they have one son, John, who is 16 years old and in form three. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.
Ann's business gives her a monthly income of 14,300 KES. This loan of 50,000 KES is Ann's third loan with KADET and she has paid her previous loans well and on time. She intends to use this loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell during this Christmas holiday. If the loan boosts her business she will open another boutique in Machakos. Ann dreams of having many boutiques in Nairobi, Athi River and Machakos. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells oil made from the kernels of the palm fruit in Abrafo near Abura. 

Adjoa has a junior high school education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a security officer. 

Adjoa has been selling palm-kernel oil for the past three years. She is responsible for paying for groceries and other utilities. She also supports her husband in paying the school fees for their children. 

Her loan will be used to buy a larger amount of the palm-fruit kernels needed to prepare the oil. Her hope is to create a larger and more consistent income. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to make sure her children receive the best education possible. She is also aiming for further expansion of her business and will therefore reinvest some of the money she makes back into it.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of the palm-fruit kernels needed to prepare the oil she makes

loans.name: Hanny

texts.en:
Hanny is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. 

She has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Hanny faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands and the high cost of transporting charcoal. She hopes to expand and establish another charcoal shop in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Baleria

texts.es:
Baleria tiene 47 años y reside junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Viven en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito Tambogrande, que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace seis años, Baleria se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino en un corral en su propio domicilio. Cuando sus ovinos ya han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal, ella se los ofrece en venta a su clientela establecida y fidelizada en el mercado local. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre y conoce a la perfección este rubro. 

Baleria desea usar el préstamo para arreglar y mantener su corral. También desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado para crecerlos a un buen nivel de desarrollo y continuar a venderlos en el mercado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Baleria is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. They have their own house in the rural district of Tambogrande, located in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Baleria has been raising sheep at her home for six years. When her sheep have grown to the ideal size and weight she sells them to her faithful customers in the local market. She learned this trade from her father and she is an expert in this field.

Baleria wants to use the loan to fix and maintain her sheep pen. She also desires to buy food for her livestock to grow them to a good size and to sell them at the market. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy food for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cement, boards... to renovate her house

loans.name: Hort's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people who will all will use their money to support their different purposes. The members selected Mrs. Hort as village bank president.

Hort and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice and corn to support their family. They do not have enough money to sustain their farming. Therefore, Hort would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to grow rice and corn. This couple has five children: one is employed and four are students who also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Madame Jean est une dame très dynamique et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’alimentation générale et diverse d’autres produits. Elle a commencé depuis 2009 son activité et revend dans une boutique non loin de la pharmacie djidjolé. Elle cherche à satisfaire tous ces clients, elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de 7 cartons de huiles patron de 1litre, 8 cartons d’eau minérale voltic, 5 cartons de boîte de sardine, 4 cartons de mayonnaise et 2 cartons de savon Fissi.
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle a 38 ans. Elle contribue aux charges ménagères avec son commerce.
texts.en: Madame Jean is a very dynamic lady and sells general food products for a living. She started in this field in 2009 and sells her wares from her shop near the Djidjolé pharmacy. In order to see to her customers' demands she is seeking a loan to purchase seven boxes of one litre bottles of oil, 8 crates of Voltic mineral water, 5 boxes of sardine tins, four boxes of mayonnaise, and two boxes of Fissi soap. She is 38 years old and  married with one child; she sees to the family's needs with the revenues from her business.

loans.use: to purchase various food products

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy S. N. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $1.25 per day. Her husband always assists the farm field. This couple has been married for many years and has two children.  One of their children, a daughter, is a grocery seller by the border of Thailand. Vuthy S. N. sees that her daughter’s business is profitable and she hopes to improve it further by accumulating a larger quantity of groceries inventory through a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her daughter's groceries business

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya doing mixed farming and producing beans, vegetables, maize and milk. He is married with two children ages 8 and 2 years. Aaron earns additional income from his work as a painter.

Aaron has requested a loan of 55,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business through purchase of additional birds and poultry feed. Aaron is optimistic this loan will improve his income just like his previous five have made life better and enabled him to provide for family  needs like clothing and food. Aaron is focusing on having six quality dairy cows.

Aaron reiterates as do other farmers that the poor market prices for their produce are the main challenge in farming business.

loans.use: To pay for purchase of poultry and feeds.

loans.name: Burulai's Group

texts.en:
Burulai B. is the treasurer of this group. She is 39 and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, Burulai are bringing up two sons –  both of whom are of pre-school age (under seven). 

In 1993, Burulai's family received a piece of land from the Kyrgyz government.  Since that time, her family has been cultivating cotton and corn. Each month, they sell a part of the harvest.  From this work, the family earns 7000 soms per month. 

With money gained from this farming activity, Burulai was able to purchase home furniture and improve their living conditions.  She hopes to obtain this loan because she needs additional money to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming. In the future, Burulai dreams of purchasing an apartment in Bishkek and of providing her sons with the best education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Chandradevi

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Chandradevi. She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 15. In 2004, she established her furniture making business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. Chandradevi has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Patan BPW and used the funds to buy pieces of wood and lumber for her business.  

In the future, Chandradevi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.    

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timber.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona secaracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Rosa desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y porcino (cerdos), su corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  También cuenta con una hectárea de terreno que le a dado en herencia su padre para que la trabaje, siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo vende en los mecados de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y su producto, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 32 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in their own home which does not receive basic services.  Their home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that many people farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.
 
Rosa has been raising and selling sheep and pigs for some years.  Her animal pens are located outside her home.  They are suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals balanced feed and natural pasture so that they reach an optimum level of development and she then sells them in the different markets in her area, making good profits which enable her to cover her family's daily expenses.  Rosa also owns a hectare of land which her father left as an inheritance for her to farm.  She grows lemons which, once harvested, she sells in the markets in her area.

Rosa has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and fertilizers to improve her land and crops.  She will use the income she makes to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Rosa is a hard-working person and very responsible.  The only thing she wants is for her family to do well and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers to improve her land and crops

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis tiene 40 años, esta casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 18 años, tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos varones, Walter (22),Juan Luis (15) y Jorge Ramón(14) los tres chicos se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Luis anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leche y poseía una carnicería, luego comenta que comenzó a interesarse por la Veterinaria y comenzó a estudiar hasta que se recibió de Dr. Veterinario, desde esa vez, y hace 3 años que posee su Agro-Veterinaria donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa, actualmente, posee su local en su domicilio, y cuenta con una clientela bien formada y realiza las consultas via telefónica y particular.
El Sr. Luis solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos que utiliza dentro de su profesion, nos referimos a la compra de  invirtió su préstamo en la compra de vitaminas,alimento para animales,vacunas y demás medicamentos que podria necesitar para el mejor desempeño de su función.
texts.en:
Luis, age 40, has been married to Sonia for 18 years.  They have three children, all boys.  Walter is 22, Juan Luis is 15, and Jorge Ramón is 14.  The three boys are in school.

Previously, Luis sold milk and had a butcher shop.  Then, he says, he started to take an interest in becoming a veterinarian.  He started his studies, and he continued until he became a Veterinarian Doctor.  He has been an Agro-Veterinarian for three years, and he works with his wife.  He currently has his business in his home, and he has well established customers.  He does telephonic and private consultations.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy supplies to use in his profession.  He will use the loan to buy vitamins, feed for animals, vaccines, and other medications that could be needed to improve his performance.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed for animals, vaccines, and other medications.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.en:
Gloria is 29 years old and lives near the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their children. They have four children age 13, 11, 6 and 2 months. 

She is a respectful, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in agriculture, growing beans and producing a local crop called “morocho,” which is a form of ground corn. She has been working in agriculture cultivating plants since she was a child alongside her parents. 

Gloria currently works alongside her husband, their children, and their relatives. She is seeking this loan to buy fertilizer. Gloria has been investing in her crops with loans for the past four years. She reports that she has been able to make more profits with the help of her loans. In the future, she hopes to improve her vehicle so that she can bring her crops to the market more directly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: La señora Giovana dedicada a la elaboración y venta  de comida esto ya hace un tiempo atrás junto a su pequeño en brazos ella durante todos los días debe de cocinar para vender y los platos para el almuerzo que los clientes vienen a degustar a medio día, la señora debe de trabajar muy dura ya que es madre soltera y ella debe de cubrir todos los gastos para mantener a su pequeño bebe pero con esfuerzo y empeño ella desea tener un a pensión mucho mas grande y así salir adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida, la Sra. Giovana, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz, harina y papa para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy dinámica agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Giovana has been making and selling food for some time.  With her little one in her arms, every day she must cook and sell lunches to her customers who come to eat at midday.  She must work very hard as she is a single mother and must cover all the expenses involved in supporting her small baby.  With effort and hard work, she would like to own a much bigger restaurant so that she can get ahead and improve her quality of life.  With her loan money, Giovana will buy groceries such as noodles, rice, flour and potatoes wholesale so that she can make her delicious dishes.  She is a very hard-working and dynamic person and is grateful to the institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice, flour and potatoes wholesale, so that she can make her delicious dishes

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi est âgée  de 30 ans .Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
 
Ayaovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009.elle revend de la friperie vers Bé et s’approvisionne au marché de Hedzranawoé.
 Elle  a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter de la friperie.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is 30 years old.  She is married to a businessman.  She doesn’t have any children in her care. 
Ayaovi has been working as a saleswoman since 2009.   She sells second-hand clothing in Bé and gets her supplies at the market in Hedzranawoé. 
She has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from hog raising.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, rice, canned goods, softdrinks, etc. for her sari-sari store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, rice, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en: Emilly is 56 years old, married and has four children, between 18 and 30 years old. She operates a restaurant business where she makes and sells local food to the people of Kambi in Kakamega. She has been in this business for three years now. She says that business is good and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy foodstuffs to make different types of dishes to sell to her customers. She sees herself growing her business, opening restaurants in other areas within Kakamega town, and building a residential house for her family. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy rice, stiff porridge, bean stew, meat stew, etc.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: The items (tubers of yam, mini-provisions shop, bread on the table, and other items) seen in the picture above is the business of Efua. She is married and has four children. Her husband is into carpentry. She attained a junior high level education. The loan when obtained will be used to buy yams and provisions to sell.  With the new proceeds from her growing business, Efua plans to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy yams and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
This is Lani, 45, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Aufracio, and is mother to three children. The eldest is already working, while two are still studying in college and elementary school. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lani maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Aside from this she also sells silver jewelries and accessories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lani dreams of expanding her business and having her own house some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old man. 

He wants to improve his work and purchase clothes in bulk for sale in the coming winter season. 

The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more clothes for the coming season and prepare well so he can compete and sell more. This will enable him to increase his income and live in better conditions. 

Mohammad is photographed in the place where he is selling clothes.


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for the coming winter season for sale.

loans.name: Valdivia

texts.es: La señora Valdivia es comerciante de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que realizara la obra fina del piso superior de su casa  y colocado de cerámica. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Llojeta en la Ciudad de La Paz; Valdivia es casada y tiene tres hijos. Valdivia es cliente de Impro desde al año 2005, sus pagos siempre han sido puntuales y esta será la segunda vez que desea que su crédito pase a través de Kiva y sus financiadores.
texts.en:
Sra. Valdivia is a clothing merchant. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that she can finish the upper floor of her house and install ceramic tiling. Her home is located in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. Valdivia is married and has three children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005. Her payments have always been on time and this will be the second time that her loan will be referred to the Kiva lenders for funding.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing the upper floor of her house and installing ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, la socia también se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos y galletas, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y también para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Maria divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs. She also has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, noodles, and cookies. Through these businesses, Maria is able to move her children forward. She wants to expand and improve her business of raising animals, so she is requesting a loan to buy pigs. Maria also wants to keep her store in operation by purchasing rice, sugar, milk, and noodles in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 41 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a farmer, and is a mother to their three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Bella makes a living by farming. She, together with her husband, plants seasonal crops of fruits and vegetables. Her products are pineapple and papaya. She’s been in this business for twenty-five years. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She makes a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php10, 000. She will be using the money to buy materials and inputs needed for farming such as fertilizers and seedlings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Bella hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Diénéba

texts.fr:
Née vers 1961 à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso),  Diénéba est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kaboïla II, dans la ville de Sikasso.
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée depuis plus de vingt années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements (pagne wax, draps de lits, tissus brodés, etc.). 
Elle achète ses marchandises  au Burkina Faso auprès des commerçants grossistes avant de les revendre en gros et en détail dans la ville de Sikasso de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
Elle est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et 10 draps de lit. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Diénéba was born circa 1961 in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She's married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Kaboïla II, city of Sikasso.

After several unsuccessful businesses, she launched herself into retailing, more than twenty years ago, notably buying and selling clothing such as "pagnes wax" (colorful African cloth), bedsheets, embroidered fabrics, etc. 

She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Burkina Faso, and resell, retail or wholesale, as a traveling saleswoman in Sikasso. Her clientele comprises mostly women.

Eager to better meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. She's seeking her second loan, to be used to bolster her working capital and buy 15 pieces of embroidered fabric, 10 pages wax, and 10 bedsheets.

With this loan, she foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used mainly to bolster her working capital, help with the family expenses, and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of embroidered fabric, 10 pages wax, and 10 bedsheets

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Neema Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Neema group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Neema group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Neema and group members and their field officer, far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gak

texts.en:
Gak is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Gak has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 48 years old and married to Mogaka. They have six children.

He has been in the scrap metal business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. He is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 after paying the previous loan on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more stocks of scrap metal and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell and hand-driven carts (Mkokoteni) to rent

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma nació en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco y tiene 37 años edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.  Actualmente, Vilma vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas.    
 
Vilma se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda  en su domicilio desde muy temprano la podemos encontrar vendiendo sus productos a sus clientes.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar más sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, harina, huevos, leche, aceite, pan y otras cosas más.   

Vilma es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Vilma was born in the city of Cusco, Cusco Province. She is 37 years old, married, and fruit of this wonderful relationship are their three children. At the moment, Vilma lives in the historic city of Cusco where she sells groceries.

She sell groceries and her store is located inside her home. Early in the morning, one can find Vilma selling her products to her clients. She has been working in this business for various years now. Vilma is requesting the loan to buy more sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, flour, eggs, milk, oil, bread, etc.

Vilma is a member of the communal bank "Pillao." This group is formed of 13 members who live in the Cusco province, San Jerónimo district

loans.use: buy more sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, flour, eggs, milk, oil, bread, etc.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el realiza servicio de taxi desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante y poder estudira alguna carrera profesional,el sueño del socio es comprar otro carro nuevo.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar respuestos para su carro como autopartes.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues working in transportation; he provides taxi services from 5am until 8pm.  Through this business he wants to get ahead and to be able to study a professional career.  His dream is to buy another new car.  He’s asking for the loan to buy spare parts for his car.  He‘s happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 48 years old; he lives in Tulkarem with his wife and his five children. He sells used electronics. He has been involved in the retail business since 2008, and he still needs a lot of improvements, so he is requesting this loan to purchase more used electronics. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, making sacrifices and pushing every once in a while to achieve his goal and become successful. His dream is to expand his business and he wants to use part of the profits on his children’s education in the future.

Osama is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more used electronics for resale.

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en:
Jairus is 24 years old and he supports four family members. He has been a dairy farmer for the last four years.
 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow to enable him to get more litres of milk to supply to his customers.

His hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and open a retail shop. His future hopes are to improve his farming and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get more litres of milk to supply to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and construct a cow shade.

loans.name: Faatamalii

texts.en:
Faatamalii, 53, is a mother of six who runs a beach resort in Saleapaga.  She earns 300-600 tala  a week catering to tourists from Aggie Grey's and many others.
Faatamalii was unemployed until she joined the SPBDF program in 2003 and started her own business to support her family.  She has had 4 previous loans, and now wishes to borrow an $1,000 to purchase two additional cabanas.
Faatamalii is one of the top business women in the SPBD program.

loans.use: To build two additional beach cottages (fale) to expand her resort business

loans.name: Fazil Ahamd

texts.en: Fazil Ahamd lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his wife whom he married a few months ago and they started a new life together. He is a shopkeeper. He has an ice cream shop and he wants to take an individual loan to buy one new ice cream machine and make and make a good life for their future and he would like to thank AFSG for supporting them.

loans.use: To buy one new ice cream machine

loans.name: Dénaka

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dénaka B., 53, is married and mother of two children. Her husband is polygamous and chooses to live with whichever of his wives has the most income, so he is not living with Mrs. B. at present. Mrs. B. earns her living selling cereals and various grocery items. Her business is flourishing, however, she frequently runs out of things because of lack of capital to keep up her inventory.

Mrs. B. is asking for a loan of $1000 which she plans to use to stock up so as to keep her inventory stable and thus improve her little general store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 53 ans, Madame B. Dénaka est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son mari est totalement absent car il a plusieurs femmes et c’est chez celle qui a plus de moyens qu’il vit. Le stockage et la vente des céréales et l’alimentation générale sont les activités principales de Madame B. Dénaka. C’est un commerce très florissant mais faute de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à s’en sortir car elle est souvent confrontée par la rupture de stock.

Afin d’être à la hauteur, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock plus consistant et relever ainsi son commerce d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: purchasing cereals and other merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: Savali is a thirty-one year old woman with six kids. She has supported her family single-handedly with  this business. She makes money with the business, but not enough to cover all of her needs, especially those of her children. That’s why she has applied for her 1st loan of $300 - to buy more meat in order to get more profit. She’s planning that her next loan will be used to cover her children’s school fees for the whole year so that it will be easier for her to focus on her business.

loans.use: Buying meat for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 43 years old and lives in Licapa, in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province, Department of La Libertad. She has one son who no longer lives with her now that he is an adult, and she has given him work in her business. Norma attended school until 9th grade.

She started her business when she worked with a friend in Laredo in a brick factory, and learned from that business. She made herself independent and was able to work alone when she received her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100) from the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas.” With this money she bought a plot of land, and with subsequent loans she bought her tools. In this way the business grew and she was able to give more and more work to the youth who live in the area.

This loan of 2,300 soles (about $767) from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 months, will be used as capital to buy another truck to deliver the bricks that they produce.

Norma dreams of having a business with state-of-the-art technology, and in this way grow and be able to export her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma tiene 43 años de edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 1 hijo, el cual no depende de ella, ya es mayor y le ha dado trabajo en su negocio. La señora Norma estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria.

Su negocio empezó cuando se asoció con un amigo para trabajar en Laredo, en la fabricación del ladrillo, allí aprendió del negocio, se independizó para trabajar sola cuando recibió su primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 ($ 100 aprox.) en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”. Con ese dinero pagó el derecho de tierra, con los siguientes préstamos compró sus implementos y así su negocio fue creciendo y pudo dar cada vez más trabajo a jóvenes de su zona.

El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo utilizará para completar el capital para la compra de otro camión, el cual será utilizado para la repartición del ladrillo que fabrica.

La señora Norma sueña con poner una empresa, con tecnología de punta, de esta manera crecer y llegar a exportar.

loans.use: Buy a truck (mobility).

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun (his sister is pictured) has his own business. He was born in 1984 and lives in the Salyan region in the village of Yenikand. This man is single. He has been in this business for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma C. Cortez works as a secretary in her husband’s automotive repair shop. They have owned this shop located on the road to Viacha for the past 6 years. The garage is rented and they have 5 employees with expertise in the different branches of automotive mechanics. This is a family business in which her sister-in-law also works. The shop is equipped with the machinery necessary for automotive repair, and they repair things like fuel injection cars. Irma is requesting this loan in order to buy a small vehicle that will permit her to provide roadside assistance because this is the most lucrative activity for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma C. Cortez, trabaja como secretaria en el taller mecánico de su esposo, con quien conjuntamente han instalado un taller hace 6 años en el camino a Viacha. Actualmente el taller se encuentra en un ambiente alquilado, y trabajan con 5 dependientes en distintos rubros de la mecánica. Se trata de una empresa familiar, donde su cuñada trabaja con ellos.
