El taller ha sido equipado con maquinaria adecuada para el tipo de trabajo que realizan, como la reparación de cerebros electrónicos, y automóviles a inyección. Irma precisa de capital para la compra de una pequeña movilidad que le permita realizar los auxilios en carretera, que son los que representan mejores ingresos para el taller.

loans.use: Purchase of a small vehicle to provide roadside assistance

loans.name: Zulika's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zulika Kyokunzire. She runs several businesses: tailoring, making and selling matooke (plaintains) and boda (driving a taxi). She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to expand business. Zulika is 40 years old and married to a businessman. She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Zulika makes approximately UGX 100,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business further. Zulika has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zulika is joined in her small group by Milly M., Lamula N. and Madina M.. Milly M. runs a butcher's store and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy more meat. Lamula N. is a nurse and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more equipment. Madina M. is in the drycleaning business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy better machines.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Leah's Songambele. Group

texts.en:
Leah is 38 years old and is married with five children, ages 29, 25, 20, 13 and 9 years. Leah is a business and trading woman; she started in 2000. Every day, Leah works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales. Leah now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Sophia, who sells food.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Florencia Cena

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia Cena V. D. R. is 45 years old and studied until the second graD.. She has five children but only 3 are dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of Libertad, Peru. In the general store that she opened in her home, she sells a variety of essential products, such as cereal grains, chicken, bread, vegetables, cleaning products, sweets, soft drinks and beer. When she began the business she began with very little and didn’t have much variety. She would buy products in arrobas (units of about 25 pound), and now she buys them by the sack. She belongs to Communal Bank “Mujeres del Olivo,” where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), and with this money she bought a variety of products to stock her store. With this loan of 600 soles (about $225), which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy 5 sacks of sugar, 2 bottles of oil and sweets. Her greatest dream is to open another store in the center of Otuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia Cena V. D. R. tiene 45 años D. edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero solo tres dependen D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. En la bodega que ha implementado en su domicilio venD. una variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad, granos D. cereales, carne D. pollo, pan, verduras, productos D. limpieza, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza. Cuando se inicio en este negocio empezó con muy poco no tenia mucha variedad, compraba por arrobas a diferencia, ahora compra por sacos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró diversos productos para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo D. S/. 600.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 5 sacos D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. aceite y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es instalar otra tienda pero en el centro D. Otuzco

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Enelesi

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Enelesi K.. She is married and has two children aged 7 and 12. In 2005, Enelesi established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where the business owner sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa makes a living by raising cows and raising vegetables on her parcels of land in the community of Santa Clara, which is far away from her home. She spends a lot of time working alone on the land and far away from her beloved family. She suffered from a tragedy when she lost her husband. Now she has to work hard to provide her children with food and other necessary things. She hopes to better her crops and she has decided to obtain a small calf and natural fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

ELSA se dedica a la crianza de vacas y al cultivo de vegetales en sus pequeñas parcelas que tiene en la comunidad de Santa Clara muy lejos de su hogar y por este motivo pasa muchas horas sola sin la compañía de su amada familia.Esto a causa de la trágica situación que le tocó vivir cuando perdió a su amado. Ahora tiene la convicción de seguir trabajando para tener a buen recaudo a sus pequeños hijos. Desea mejorar su sembrío ha decidido adquirir una pequeña ternerita además de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para su cultivo de vegetales.

loans.use: Purchase a calf, manure, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein I. is 24 years old. He is married. He has a child who is one and a half years old. Husein’s son is small now, but Husein is already working hard in order to ensure his son has the best future.

Husein sells foodstuffs like cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, and canned mayonnaise in the store, which he rents. He has been in this business for 8 years. Husein is very polite and his trading place is very popular among the local inhabitants. This means he has many clients. The business generates the main income for the family.

Today Husein requests 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 12 months. He is going to spend the loan on purchasing foodstuffs so he can enlarge the range of goods he sells. This will enable him to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his family fully. Husein thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to enlarge the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Elsa Lelia

texts.es:
Elsa has been a cattle rancher for 20 years. She started breeding cows and selling their milk ever since she got married. Over the years, she has seen the fruit of her labor, which has allowed her to raise her 3 children. Aside from this, she and her husband grow potatoes, corn, and carrots on their extensive land. Her wish is to improve her breed of cows little by little. This time, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase balanced nourishment for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa es ganadera hace 20 años, empezó desde que se casó, cría vacas y vende la leches que estas producen, al transcurrir de los años ve el fruto de su trabajo que le ha permitido atender a sus 3 hijos.Además de esto, en las amplias extensiones de terreno que poseen ella y su esposo cultivan papa, maíz y zanahoria.Su deseo es ir mejorando poco a poco la raza de su vacas, esta vez, solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de alimento balanceado para estas.

loans.use: Purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
Justiniana is 44 years old, divorced, and lives with her two sons. José is 15 and Nilton is 10, and both are students. This mother was only able to finish elementary school, since the low economic level of her family forced her to work in order to help with household expenses. Thus, from childhood, Justiniana has learned to take care of herself. After separating from her husband 12 years ago, Justiniana found it a good idea to use her life savings to open a small store in her home. That same business has enabled her to provide for her two children throughout the years. Justiniana likes to man the store, although being there all day every Monday through Saturday makes her tired. She wants to see her sons become professionals, and that’s why she puts so much effort into her work. With the loan that she will receive, Justiniana will be able to purchase more merchandise in order to supply her store and thereby help her business grow, making it larger and more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Justiniana tiene 44 años, es divorciada, vive con sus dos hijos; José de 15 y Nilton de 10, los cuales son estudiantes. Esta madre solo estudio hasta terminar la primaria, ya que los bajos recursos económicos de su familia la obligaron a trabajar para apoyar en los gastos de la casa, es así que desde muy pequeña ha aprendido a valerse por sí misma.Al separarse de su esposo, hace doce años atrás, le pareció buena idea utilizar sus ahorros de toda la vida para abrir una pequeña tienda en su casa, negocio con el cual ha estado manteniendo todos estos años a sus dos hijos.A doña Justiniana le gusta atender su tiendita, aunque permanecer todo el día de lunes a sábado se le hace cansado. Ella quiere ver a sus dos hijos hechos profesionales, por eso que le pone tanto empeño a su trabajo. Con el dinero que obtenga podrá comprar más mercadería para implementar su tienda y así poder crecer en su negocio, haciéndolo más grande y rentable.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma B., born in 1974, comes from Potočari near Srebrenica where she is married and has four children. Her husband is employed, but his salary is not sufficient to pay all of their expenses. One of their children is a student receiving study support in the amount of 150 KM (about $100), but study in Bosnia costs much more.

Selma raises cows, a good income source for the family, and she is requesting a loan in the amount of $725 to buy winter reserve food for her cattle.

loans.use: To buy food for her cattle.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora T. es una dama muy alegre y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos los cuales los comercializa en el mercado central de Chinandega. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora ya que ha logrado mantener el negocio desde hace 10 años.

Una de las razones por las cuales ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para la compra de los productos por la razón de que sus estantes deben de ser llenos para que de esta manera pueda vender y así obtener ingresos para el mejoramiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora T. is a very cheerful lady with a great spirit of improvement in her business of selling clothes and cosmetics, which she sells in the central market of Chinandega. This lady is a hard-working person who has already managed to stay in business for 10 years. One of the reasons why she has sought support from Ceprodel is for the purchase of products so that her shelves are full, so that she can sell products and earn money to upgrade her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high education and is responsible for taking care of her family's basic needs. Her husband is a fisherman.

Diana started her business not long ago. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and gari. Gari is made out of cassava only; the cassava is milled into dough and then the starch is extracted to reduce the starch content. The dough is then fried into gari, which is very popular in the country. Diana also prepares other food for sale. She does her business at Elmina.

Diana will use her loan to buy raw cassava for the production of gari and also to increase her rice sales. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy raw cassava to produce gari and to increase her rice sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 60-year-old widow with 4 children. She sells plantains. The demands for her plantains are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more plantains to sell. She says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Lieu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Liệu 54 tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay công việc đem alị thu nhậpchính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và thu nhập từ cửa hàng sửa xe đạp của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

Vòng vốn tới chị Liệu mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua phụ tùng đầu tư cho công việc sửa chữa xe đạp của chồng, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Lieu is 54 years old. She joined TYM fund since 1995. She lives with her husband and 1 grown son. Currently her family's main source of income is from raising animals and her husband's bicycle repair shop at 230 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy accessories/spare parts for her husband's bicycle repair shop, and the remainder to buy feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Disso Group

texts.fr: Depuis 1987, les femmes du groupement sont enregistrées à la Chambre de compétences de Mekhé. Elles ont acquis de réelles capacités dans le domaine du commerce. Déjà, deux femmes du groupement disposent de leur propre boutique et comptent ainsi avec le projet de microcrédit renforcer les produits d’alimentation, une autre dispose d’un étal de friperie. Les autres membres utiliseront leur part pour faire du commerce ambulant avec la vente de divers produits (alimentation, produits artisanaux).
texts.en:
Since 1987, the women of this group have been registered with the Chamber of Competence in Mekhé. They have acquired real capabilities in the domain of commerce. Two of the women in the group already have their own shops and are counting on this micro-loan to bolster their inventory of foodstuffs. Another woman has a stall where she sells used clothing. The other members will use their share as ambulant saleswomen selling various products (foodstuffs, hand-crafted objects).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is a fifty-one-year-old married woman with two children, both girls. Both of her daughters are in junior high school. Augustina’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and people to and from Berekum and Sunyani. She lives with the husband and their children in their own house, earned with much toil and trouble, in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Augustina is a food vendor. She cooks ‘banku’ in her house and sells on the street. "Banku" is a local food prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. Augustina buys bags of maize and other ingredients directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages where the cost is competitive. Augustina has been in business for over twenty years. Apart from the food-selling business, Augustina also sells drinks and biscuits. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize and other goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: N., 36 years old, is a resident of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of four children: all of them are single and students. She is married to Cay, 37, who is a motor taxi driver. For more than a year, N. has owned a big field given by her parents, where she plants watermelon. She takes her watermelon to sell in the market by herself so that she can earn a good price; she always looks for an available field of watermelon to buy wholesale. If she could do that, she could earn a good profit. Because now is the harvest season for the upcoming Khmer New Year's Eve, N. is taking a loan of $250 to buy watermelon from the field at wholesale. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy watermelon at wholesale

loans.name: Chhoem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of three people; Mrs. P. is the team leader. P., age 51, works as cleaning staff in the garment industry. She gets a specific salary of US$ 80 a month to manage her family's daily expenses. She is married with six children; two of them are married and live separately. Her four single children are employed as sewing workers in a garment factory. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. The family faces difficulty with transportation to work because the workplaces are located far from their home. Therefore, P. is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride to work.

The other two borrowers are:

Ren S., a garment worker seeking a loan to replace her old motorbike to ride to work; and

Oun S., a worker in the garment industry who requests a loan to run a grocery store.

The borrowers live in KonTok Commune, in Kandal Province.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en:
M. Radjab is 48 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, both of whom are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village to grow different kinds of crops like wheat, potato, onion and other vegetables. They have been in this business since 2004. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Radjab would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (geretings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Christina N. S. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting an orphaned girl. Christina has been running a grocery (genge) business since 2004. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof where general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her sister-in-law. Christina currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fruits in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Christina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits in bulk for her store

loans.name: Fidelite

texts.en:
Fidelite A. is a 29-year-old who lives in Nyamasaria and sells both used and ready-made clothes. She purchases her clothing stock either in Kibuye market (Kisumu’s largest open-air market) or Nairobi. She chooses the clothes she sells by looking for what her customers like. Sometimes she will see 10 customers, other days 5 and sometimes no customers come.

Fidelite is married and has one son, age 6, named Frank. Frank says that when he grows up, he would like to be a doctor. Fidelite likes running her own business because it means she does not have to ever go begging to her husband. She likes purchasing things on her own instead of waiting for him. She hopes to use this loan to purchase more clothing stock. Her hopes for the future are to expand her business so that one day she will own her own boutique.

In this video, you can hear me greet Fidelite saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Fidelite responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Perla de 15 años y Fabricio de 11 en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy joven incursionó en varios oficios, pero al tener su familia su dedicación tenía que ser hacia ellos, ya que sus hijos aún están en edad escolar, es por eso que decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de cerveza, ya que este negocio le permite realizarlo desde su casa, pudiendo, a la par, atender a su familia. Gloria realiza pedidos al camión distribuidor de estas bebidas y posteriormente las vende en su domicilio, siempre trata de tener una buena cantidad de producto, puesto que esta bebida es muy solicitada y obtiene buenos ingresos con la venta, aunque veces no tiene el dinero necesario para pedir en mayores cantidades y cuando llega el fin de semana, cuando hay mayor demanda, ya se le terminaron sus productos. Gloria espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que gracias a éste se siente independiente y brinda a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una clienta antigua de Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha mostrado dedicación y responsabilidad hacia su banco comunal, además sus compañeras también son sus amigas. Con el dinero que esta vez está solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de estas bebidas para que le alcance para los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and lives with her partner and her children: Perla, who is 15, and Fabricio, who is 11. She owns her own home. She is a very hard-working woman, and has done various jobs since she was very young. After having her children, though, she had to shift her focus to them. Once her children were both in school, she decided to get back to work. She started selling beer, since she could do so from home and thus care for her family at the same time. Gloria places orders with beer delivery trucks, then sells the beer from her home. She tries to keep well-stocked, since this beverage is in high demand and she earns good money selling it. Sometimes, though, she doesn't have enough money to buy large quantities of beer and runs out by the time the weekend comes. Gloria hopes to continue to expand her business, since it makes her feel independent and helps her provide her family with a higher quality of life. She is a long-time client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has always shown herself to be dedicated and responsible to her village bank. Her fellow group members are also her friends. With this loan, Gloria will buy more beer so that her supply will last through the weekend.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To renovate her restaurant

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh S. is a 27-year-old man and the father of one school-aged child. He currently lives with his older mother who is a farmer. He was married, but divorced his wife when his child was very young. Since 1998, Penh S. has had fishing and farming jobs. In the past, Penh S. has always borrowed the neighbor’s boat to fish, but he now hopes to own a boat by using a Kiva loan to buy it. He said he thanks lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a boat for fishing

loans.name: Melvin Arnulfo

texts.es: El señor Melvin Q. tiene la edad de 23 años, habitante de la comarca el Ceiba del municipio de villa del carmen, soltero, vive en casa propia con sus padres, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen como técnico de catastro desde hace seis meses. Sus proyectos ofrecerle mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia por medio de la construcción total de su vivienda y obtener un mejor trabajo con mayores prestaciones. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construccion como: cemento, hierro, zinc, bloques para un anexo.
texts.en:
Sr. Melvin Q. is 23 years old and is a resident of the Ceiba District of the town of Villa del Carmen. He is single and lives in his own home with his parents. He is employed by the town of Villa del Carmen and has been working for six months as a technician in the land registry department.

He has undertaken home improvement projects in order to provide greater comfort and safety for his family. He would also like to secure a better job with more benefits. Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC, he will purchase materials such as cement, iron, zinc, and blocks to build an extension to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn V. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Charilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charilyn owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Charilyn has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 4,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Charilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Servillano

texts.en:
Servillano S. Jr. is 37 years old and married to Joy, who supports him in managing their general store and eatery business situated in the village of Raniag, Ramon, Isabela. Servillano would like to develop the business in order to provide for the needs of his family, especially his three children who are studying in high school and elementary school. His children are Adely Joy, 14, and in third year high school; Anthony James, 10, a grade VI student, and Arjay, 8, a grade III student.

Servillano has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. This will be of great help in improving and growing his small business. He is also thankful for the support of his wife and his children who serve as his inspiration to work hard.

loans.use: Aa additional capital

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap S., age 34, and her husband, Mr. Sina Poch, age 48, were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of the children attend the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pheap has been selling fish for seven years. Her husband assists her in her business. Besides selling fish, the couple also grows rice on their farm.  

Pheap wants to supplement their income by starting a new business: producing rice wine. She will able to earn extra income. Pheap is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to build a shelter for producing rice wine and to purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and build a shelter for producing rice wine.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Rosina is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also hawks the bread (sells door-to-door) in her community. Rosina buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Eden Mae

texts.en:
Eden Mae J. is a 21-year-old mother who aspires to lift her family from poverty.  She joined ASHI in October 2009 because she believes it can help her achieve this dream, because ASHI strives for poverty eradication in the Philippines.  Eden felt in her heart that getting a loan through ASHI could change their lives for the better. Garry, Eden’s husband, supports his wife’s decision and believes in her mission for the family, especially for their two children who are ages 2 months old and 19 months old. 

The loan Eden requests through ASHI will be used to start a hog fattening (pig raising) business.  While Eden takes care of her two children at home, she can use her time productively by raising pigs in their backyard.  Once the pigs have grown, they will be sold live or slaughtered for pork retailing. Profits from this business will be saved for the future education of her children and to augment her husband’s income from being a laborer.

Although Eden is just starting with her business, she hopes to grow it to a piggery some day.  With her membership in ASHI and access to larger loans over time, as well as the support of her husband, she knows she will be able to achieve success in her business.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Jack Harrison

texts.es:
El socio JACK HARRISON pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural del departamento de Apuricma, provincia de Andahuaylas, pero radica en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  

El socio tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, es abogado.  El socio tiene un pequeño negocio de librería donde vende cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, papeles, borradores, reglas, etc.  

El socio requiere el préstamo para la implementación de su librería aumentando el capital del negocio. El socio en la librería también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, impresiones, anillados, empastados de cuadernos, etc. El socio quiere comprar en el futuro varias fotocopiadoras.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Jack Harrison belongs to the communal bank "VIRGIN ASUNTA", an affiliate of Kiva. He is from the department of Apuricma, province of Andahuaylas, but lives in the province of Calca, of the department of Cusco, located an hour inside the province of Cusco. Jack is 47 years old, he is married, he has two children, and is a lawyer. He has a small business, a bookstore where he sells notebooks, books, paper, mechanical pencils, rulers, erasers, etc. He requires the loan in order to enlarge the capital of his business. In his bookstore, he also offers a photocopying service, copies, ringed binders, hardcover notebooks, etc. He wants to buy several photocopiers for the future. He is very grateful for the opportunity offered by means of this loan and thus he promises to comply with re-payment according to the timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment the capital of his business, buying more supplies for his store

loans.name: Ebun

texts.en:
Ebun is a LAPO client. She sells sarongs of various colors and sizes. She hopes to own a fashion home in the future. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She is 36 years old and married with a child. She has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. 
She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Con dos hijos que mantener y con las necesidades del hogar, muy esforzadamente la señora Estela G. trabaja para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que requiere con mucho esfuerzo su apoyo para salir adelante en su desarrollo como personas en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.

La señora Estela G. tiene la necesidad de invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir el muro frontal de su vivienda para dar mayor seguridad a su familia ya que actualmente ella cubre la parte frontal de su vivienda con trozos de árboles y con alambre de púa por lo que  necesita muy urgentemente levantar un muro de concreto y para ello requiere materiales de construcción como son bloques, arena, cemento, vigas, entre otros. Espera en que su crédito le será otorgado para llevar a cabo esta obra de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Estela G., who lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur, has two children and a home to support. She makes quite an effort to work toward improving her family's living conditions who need her help to get ahead and to develop as people. Estela needs to buy materials to build a front wall on her property so that her house will be more secure. Currently, she covers the front part of her property with tree trunks and barbed wire. It is urgent to build a concrete wall and she needs materials like concrete blocks, sand, cement, beams, etc. She hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can bring about this work which will be of much benefit for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Martha Dels Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha Del Socorro tiene 53 años, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de la compra-venta de mercadería en general. Vende ropa, cosméticos, lo cual distribuye de manera ambulante, Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. La señora dio inicio a este negocio hace  bastante tiempo, sin embargo ha luchado mucho en su vida por tratar de proporcionarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario en la vida. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos varios, ya que actualmente tiene bastante pedidos, ya que esta entregándoles mercancías a otras personas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Martha Del Socorro is 53 and has three grown children. She buys and sells general merchandise. She is a street vendor, and she sells clothes and cosmetics. She has been doing this for ten years. She started her business some time ago. Nevertheless, she has fought a lot in her life to try to give her children all of life’s necessities. The loan is to buy various products. Right now she has a lot of orders because she is delivering merchandise to other people. Her dream has always been to have better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Houwaida

texts.en:
Houwaida has been working as a private teacher in her home for the past 18 years. A mother of two children, she helps her husband in providing the family's income.

Houwaida is asking to borrow $700 to prepare a speciA. education room in her house with a board and student chairs, because she managed to take in a large number of students from her village and its surroundings.

loans.use: prepare a special education room in her house

loans.name: Betty Nyaranga

texts.en:
Betty L. is 33 years old, is married, and has four children who are all in school. Her firstborn son joined high school early this year while her last-born is in kindergarten. 

Betty is looking for a loan through KADET to help her to add more stock to her business. She intends to buy three bales of flour, six kilograms of sugar and some cooking oil.

Betty’s shop is situated in the village away from the town centre and this causes her to get many customers who buy from her instead of traveling miles away to the supermarkets. Her clients consist mainly of local consumers who live in the area.

Betty intends to use the profits to benefit her family in paying school fees for her children and also paying for the family upkeep. Her husband is currently jobless and this makes her work hard to put food on the table.

loans.use: To add more stock to her store

loans.name: Josefina Teodosa

texts.en:
Josefina is 54 years old and single. She has no kids and lives in Guayaquil in a cement house with all the basic services.

Josefina was first introduced to the business of selling Avon products through a friend. Using the money she had saved, Josefina bought the merchandise and began selling it herself.

Josefina has fixed clients that she visits during the day to sell the perfumes and lotions she buys from Avon. She is able to buy the Far Away perfume for $26.25 and sell it for $35. Another type of perfume she buys for $28.50 and sells for $38. The lotion she buys for $4.50 and sells for $6.

One difficulty with her work is that Josefina sells her products on credit and sometimes her customers do not pay.

With the loan, Josefina will buy more Avon products to expand her inventory. She would like to continue working with the Avon products and also branch out into Nature’s Garden products as well.

Josefina would also like to finish the construction on her house so she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana, a 26-year single woman living with her two parents, owns a jewelry shop where she produces both bags and hand-made jewelry products requested by her clients. She has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years and is very talented in making beautiful designs.

Today, Rana is requesting to borrow $1,200 for the second time to buy supplies such as beads, accessories, bags etc. to offer more products to her clients and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as beads, accessories, bags

loans.name: Chérifath

texts.fr: M. Chérifath est née le 22 Novembre 1962 et vit depuis huit ans au quartier Sèdjèko, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Chérifath est mère de trois enfants qui vivent tous avec elle. Mais seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Chérifath ne vit plus avec son mari. Chérifath  assure donc seule les différentes charges de la famille. Chérifath n'a fait que l'école primaire. Il y a près de 20 ans que Chérifath mène comme activité, la vente de l'encens à Porto-Novo. Chérifath s'approvisionne au Ghana, Etat voisin du Bénin. Chérifath a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Chérifath sollicite un deuxième crédit, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et d'agrandir son activité pour se faire plus de revenu. Chérifath ambitionne plus tard construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Chérifath M. was born November 22nd 1962 and has been living for eight years in Sèdjèko, an area of the 12th district of the city of Porto-Novo. Chérifath is mother of three children who all live with her. But not the three of them are attending school. Chérifath does not live anymore with her husband, so that she has to take care by herself of the family expenses. She attended only primary school. For about twenty years she has been selling incense in Porto-Novo. She purchases her supplies in Ghana, a neighbor country. Chérifath already received a loan from ALIDé, and she fully repaid it. Now she is requesting a second loan in order to increase the stock of her products and expand her business to make more revenue. In the future Chérifath hopes to build her own house.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of incense

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary’s business is of two kinds — the sale of drinks and sachet water, and a fashion designer. She is very happy with the way her business is growing. She is able to make profit that she reinvests into the business. She has been in the business for more than 15 years and she has been able to retain many customers with her good relationship with them. 

Mary is married with two children and she is 36 years old. Her husband is a transporter and they combine their take-home pay to manage their home financially. Mary hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to buy more drinks, sachet water and tailoring materials to sell. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, sachet water and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono K. is a 23 year old farmer, who lives near Litein in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He's been farming for seven years already and sells his milk to local traders. He also earns income from a small-scale tea production. He says that the main challenges to his business have been a lack of capital to invest in his business and that there are no nearby veterinary services.

Rono successfully completed a previous loan for Kshs. 40,000 through Juhudi Kilimo and requested this loan, also for Kshs. 40,000, to purchase another dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his farm and allow him to pay school fees for his younger siblings. In the future, he would like to build a modern dairy unit and plant enough feed for his cows and expand his farm.

He added that "Juhudi has really improved his dairy business."

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Angela Felicitas

texts.es: Ángela Felicita tiene 77 años. La actividad económica a la que Ángela se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio.  Esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos pues ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Por lo que tiene muchas energías y muchos clientes que asisten a su negocio pues para ella es muy importante. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar gaseosas, jugos, rosquillas, pan y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ángela Felicita is 77 years old. She runs a local store, which she has been doing for 31 years. This is not her first experience with microcredit loans and has shown herself to be a responsible person. She is very energetic and has many customers who come to her store, which is very important to her. This is why her microcredit loan will be used to buy items such as sodas, juices, rosquillas (a type of doughnut), bread and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
34-year-old A. Santa has been a teacher for a period stretching to over fifteen years in Kanjuki, Kayunga. She has also eked out profits from a small farming business. These two businesses have been her reliable sources of livelihood and she gleefully reveals that she has managed to make substantial and worthwhile progress with earnings from them.

Santa has a streak of hard work that she has used to her merit in concurrently running her two businesses. This is the one attribute that looks certain to propel her to greater heights in the future.

Notwithstanding the low remuneration that teachers in Uganda receive, she has not despaired like the rest of her colleagues. She has chosen to make the best out of that predicament by being proactively diligent. All her four children are in schools worth speaking of as up-to-the-mark.

For this married mother of four, every day means drawing up a plan of action for the betterment of her family's welfare, now and in the near future. With this loan, a foresighted Santa says she wants to be empowered the more to handle her future projects. She wants to try her hand at brick-making.

loans.use: To purchase brick-making equipment and improve her farming activities

loans.name: Mrs. Ngaet Bich Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet B. is 38 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by its 16 members located in Trapeang Chhuk village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support a different purpose. Mrs. Ngaet B. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, and her husband, Mr. Pen Soeung, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. In order to increase income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Ngaet B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are students who also help their mother with the farming. All the members are shown in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
Alcancía Comunal RIOS D. AGUA VIVA, está conformado por 8 integrantes todos muy entusiasmadas en el programa prosperidad D. Edaprospo y en trabajar en unión y formar sus propios ahorros con un el objetivo la mejorar su economía y el bienestar familiar. 
Violeta es la secretaria del grupo empezó su negocio D. comida llevando en forma delivery a algunas fabricas D. obreros que habían por su casa, el negocio le fue bien y decidió alquilar un local donD. hasta ahora tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida, uno D. sus objetivos es tener una cadena D. restaurantes además desea apoyar a sus hijas a terminar con sus estudios universitarios.
Sabina es la tesorera del grupo nos comenta que su hija comenzó con el negocio D. venta D. comida rápida como: salchipapas y mazamorras en su casa, luego traspaso su negocio a Sabina, quien ahora venD. a una cuadra D. su casa el negocio tiene sus temporadas pero en general le va bien, a ella le gustaría apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios además terminar D. construir su vivienda. Ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es albañil.
La Presidenta es Martha una persona entusiasta y jovial, ella venD. productos naturales que han mejorado su salud así como D. algunas D. las socias. Pero eso no es suficiente para ella, así que también venD. libros D. consulta y como es enfermera trabaja cuidando pacientes por día.
Martha colaboro con la organización  del grupo así que los socios están contentos D. haber encontrado el apoyo económico D. Kiva mediante Edaprospo.
texts.en:
The Rios D. Agua Viva Communal Alliance is maD. up of 8 members, all very enthusiatic about the Edaprospo prosperity program and about working together to build their own savings, with the goal of improving their economic states and the well being of their families. Violeta is the secretary of the group. She started her takeout food business by delivering to the workers at certain manufacturing plants near her home. The business was going well and she decided to rent a location where she has her food selling business to this day. One of her goals is to have a chain of restaurants. She'd also like to support her daughters to finish their university studies. Sabina is the treasurer. She told us that her daughter started a fast food business selling such items as sausages with fries and porridge in her home. Later, she transferred the business to Sabina, who now sells a block away from her house. The business is seasonal, but is going well overall. She would like to support her children in their studies, and finish building her home. She counts on the support of her husband who is a mason. Martha is the president, a very jovial and enthusiastic person. She sells natural products that have improved her health and that of some of her friends. But that's not enough for her; she also sells reference books and, since she's a nurse, works in patient care during the day. Martha worked to organize the group, and the members are now all happy to have found the financial support of Kiva through Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and raw materials

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala A. is 38 years old and married with four children, ages 5 to 15.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.  

Kalala needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be about $138 per week) to improve her business.

In 2008, Kalala joined SPBD, and this is her 3rd loan with them. SPBD's loans are Kalala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela, 43, lives in historic Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its history and culture. She is married to M. S., and has three sons and a daughter. None of her children could get an education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son started working at an early age to support the family financially. One of her sons is a tailor and the other runs a spare parts shop.

Jameela’s husband sells vegetables and has a shop in the vegetable market. He has been in this business for the last 30 years. His fresh, high-quality vegetables attract customers to his shop. Jameela has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who wants to bring more seasonal vegetables into his shop for selling. With the help of this investment her husband will be able to put his business in better condition and increase his income. She is also confident that the increased profits, combined with the savings from her sewing business, will allow her to construct another room in her family’s two-room brick house.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm M., 49 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Em, 48 years old, have been married since 1983 and have five children - four sons and a daughter. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers and two attend school. 

Mrs. Norm M. has been in the business of buying and reselling small and flowering trees in her village since 1983. She grows some of them by herself. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to use for growing small and flowering trees to sell.

loans.use: To use for growing small and flowering trees to sell

loans.name: Muneer

texts.en:
Muneer is a young father from Bethlehem district, he used to work in Israel, he stopped working there as he is now banned from crossing to there. 
He rented a small shop in his area and started a grocery store, the store is the only source of income he and the family have. 

Muneer came to FATEN and took a $3,000 loan to buy the needed goods for the store. Muneer who appears in the picture is married and has two sons.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Magsarjalam

texts.en: Magsarjalam D. is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and one son in Huvsgul, a province of Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic tent home. His wife is a teacher and is currently retired. Magsarjalam makes furniture for the local community. He started this business in 1980 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his town. He produces various kinds of wood items and hopes to build a broad customer base. Currently, his earnings are the only source of income for his family, so he is focusing on expanding his business in order to improve his family’s financial situation. With almost 30 years of owning his own business, Magsarjalam has not only gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products, but he has also gained business knowledge. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more timber to make the wood used in gers and to buy furniture-making supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy timber and furniture-making supplies

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha está separada del esposo el cual la abandono con un bebé, que ahora tiene cuatro años; vive en alquiler en la zona de Pasankery  de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con un ambiente el cual utiliza como taller de costura de trajes, abrigos, pantalones para varón y mujer, dejando sus trabajos en tiendas de la zona Sur de la ciudad de la Paz y  es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de dos maquinas de coser rectas industriales  y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is separated from her husband, who abandoned her with their baby, now 4 years old; she lives in a rented house in Pasankery, a neighborhood of La Paz.
She has a room she uses as sewing workshop, where she sews dresses, coats, men and women’s trousers; she then sells her clothes to shops located in the southern area of La Paz. This is how she earns money to provide for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two sewing machines in order to increase her earnings.
This is her first loan, and according to the socio-economic analysis carried out on her she is positively qualified to be granted a loan.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
Esta clienta e madre soltera y tiene a cargo a 1 hijo el cual mantiene con le negocio de la venta de sopa y quien ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en este negocio 
Este crédito los esta solicitando para la compra de materia prima para la venta de comida ya que atiende a los trabajadores de la alcaldía  
Por lo que le interesa mucho agrandar el negocio por la buena demanda que tiene
texts.en: This borrower is a single mother with one son, who runs a business selling soup and has 5 years of experience doing so.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for the food she sells to workers in her village.  She is very interesting in expanding her business because she has a lot of demand.

loans.use: to buy staple grains

loans.name: Carlos Ruben

texts.es: El Señor Carlos  es soltero vive en la ciudad de el alto en Villa Juliana calle  vive  con su abuelita, su actividad económica es la venta de chamarras  coreanas juveniles que vende el las ferias también viaja  a Oruro, desaguadero y al mismo tiempo es chofer propietario de  un taxi que trabaja por las tardes  el desembolso realizado lo utilizo en el mantenimiento y reparación de su taxi  para luego realizar la venta de la movilidad y  comprar otra, el Joven Carlos es querido por su buen carácter,  puntual con sus cuotas muestra responsabilidad con sus actividades, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carlos is single and lives in the city of El Alto with his grandmother.  His business is selling Korean jackets for children.  He sells these in the markets and also travels to Oruro to sell.  At the same time, he is also the owner-driver of a taxi which he works in the afternoons.  He used his loan to have some maintenance and repair work done on his taxi so that he could then sell it and buy another.  Young Carlos is well loved for his good character.  He is also punctual with his repayments and shows a lot of responsibility in his business activities.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos.  Por diversos motivos Natalia no puedo estudiar.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías, teje pantalones y chompas que luego vende a sus vecinos y amigos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar lanas para tejer más prendas y así generarse más ingresos.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un terreno y crecer en su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of  the "Progress for Azangarinas" Community Bank located in the district and province of Azangaro in the Department of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children.  For various reasons, Natalia cannot study.

Natalia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years.  Her first loan of 500 New Soles was money that was used to raise capital for her business.  She sells handicrafts, knitting pants and sweaters that she sells to neighbors and friends.  She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 New Soles, which she will use to buy wool to knit more garments and so generate more revenue.

Her dream for the future is to own some land and grow her business. What she likes most about her Community Bank are the meetings and the training talks.

loans.use: Purchasing wool at wholesale

loans.name: María Agusta

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector del Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su gran variedad en la gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 15 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad, su tercer hijo está en el colegio y su ultima hija en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora como carpintero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, vende puerta a puerta a sus amigas y conocidas pero solo medio día.  También labora realizando la limpieza de una casa, esta en este trabajo hace 10 años, labora de lunes a viernes.

Es el cuarto crédito que realiza en el  banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para la temporada de navidad. Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the communal bank Las Caleras. She lives in the Tejar sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its historical center, its churches, its diverse cuisine and its people who conserve their culture and traditions.

María is 37 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 22, 18, 15 and 4. Her oldest son is married and lives on his own. Her second son goes to university, her third son is in high school, and her youngest  daughter is in pre-school. Her husband works as a carpenter. They don't own their own home and are renters.    

María works selling every kind of clothing. She has been doing this for 2 years. She sells door to door to her friends and acquaintances, but only for half the day. She also works cleaning a house. She has had that job for 10 years and works at it from Monday through Friday.  

This is the fourth loan that she has taken out in the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying more merchandise for the Christmas season. Her greatest dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 39, is married with five children aged 10 to 18. She has had her business for about eighteen years, operating from 6am to 8pm daily.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan in order to expand her shop by adding cosmetics, foodstuffs such as tomatoes sauce, rice and different types of flour and other goods which seem to be in high demand in her business area.

With this loan, Jacqueline hopes to earn more profit than with her simple previous business. She will start saving, as well as improve her family situation.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, de 42 años, está casado con Fortunata, de 40 años, y tienen 5 hijos; juntos habitan en su casa propia en el distrito de Samugari, perteneciente a la selva Ayacuchana.

Benito cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en los trabajos del campo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Actualmente viene sembrando cacao, café, coca plátano,  achiote y palillo; ya que estos son los productos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que puedan afectarlos, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy contento.
Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono, insecticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
Benito, 42 years old, is married to Fortunata, 40 years old, and they have 5 children. They live together in their own house in the district of Samugari belonging to the Ayacuchana forest.

Benito counts on the support of his wife in their work in the countryside. With a lot of effort he has managed to make his land very productive and now plants a little of everything because he knows that whatever produce he obtains will be of good quality. These days he has been planting cocoa, coffee, coca, banana, achiote, and palillo as these are the most in-demand products in the market.

What he most likes about his work is protecting his sown fields from the pests that could affect them and greatly reduce his earnings. He has been carrying out this activity for 9 years and considers the most difficult to be transporting his crops to the city of San Francisco, since it's there where he sells his produce. For the future of his business he hopes to collect the money necessary to buy new land.

This is the 16th loan that he has had from MFP and knows that this loan will help him a lot in the development of his activities. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is very happy about it. The two thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in improving his crops, for which he will buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia G. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Virginia is the leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Virginia runs a general store, where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Virginia joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting her first loan, for 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Bilegtbaatar

texts.en:
Bilegtbaatar, 25, is married and lives with his wife and two-year-old child in Hentiy province in Mongolia. His wife works at a telephone company where she is paid 300,000 MNT monthly.  Their child attends kindergarten. 

Bilegtbaatar began a taxi service business in 2008 with his old car in the province center where he lives. Then in 2010, he bought another car, which he currently uses to operate his taxi service. Now, he has regular customers and his business has become more stable. His daily net income is 15,000 to 20,000 MNT, from which he spends 8000 MNT for gas. 

Bilegtbaatar is a hardworking, honest, and polite person who says, "My car is getting outdated and always breaks down. I spend money for spare parts and maintenance fees. I am trying to save more money to buy a new car so that I can save money."

Bilegtbaatar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to add to the money he has saved up to buy a  new car.

loans.use: To buy new car to taxi service

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKELEMA sont mariés  avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la commune de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beurre de karité..
AWA S. compte acheter avec son  prêt  250kg de noix de karité pour les transformer en beurre. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village et dans les villages environnants .Le beurre de karité est  ensuite vendu au  grand marché de Kadiolo ville et au marché de Lofigué à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.250 FCFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre partie pour les dépenses familiales. 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKELEMA solidarity group are married women who average 28 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of  Tiébiziédougou, in Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members sell shea butter. This is their first time collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Awa S. intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of sheanuts to make butter. She gets her stocks in the village and surrounding areas. The shea butter is then sold at the grand market of Kadiolo and at the Lofigué market, for cash, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,250 FCFA, which will be to repay the loan and interest, and to cover family expenses. Her goal is to increase her revenue and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheanuts

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 47 years old. Elvie is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, catching fish for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing net to be be used for expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Memunatu M.. She is married and has two children, aged 21 and 29 years. In the year 2000, Memunatu established her foodstuff business. She began her business as a means of contributing to the development of her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000 000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Memunatu plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bag of groundnuts and onions for her business

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie B. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies for her cosmetics sales business.  Gerlie has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a beauty salon.  Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes G. is from the village of Akhouryan in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is happily married and, together with his wife, has been working on the family farm for the past ten years. He hopes to save enough money someday to renovate the family home. In addition to providing for his family, Hovhannes also helps his brother’s family with produce grown on the family farm.  

Hovhannes would like a loan to purchase animal feed. He expects the family income to increase by twenty five percent with this investment. He enjoys living in Akhuryan and is surrounded by his relatives and good friends.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea, a 31-year-old married mother of three children, works hard to provide for her family by running a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines. In the business for 10 years, she also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Having repaid her three previous loans from NWTF, Lea is now requesting loan of a PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of beverages to sell. Lea aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 35 years old. Ferdinand is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ferdinand owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling coconuts & bananas in the local community. Ferdinand has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ferdinand joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ferdinand is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of bananas & coconuts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ferdinand from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est crée le 25 juillet 2003. les 15 femmes qui le composent s'activent dans le maraichage, la vente de l'huile de palme et le petit commerce

Madame Sounkar qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est Mariée et mère de deux enfants en sa charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de l'huile de palme. Elle pratique ces activités depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer ses activités.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes(nourriture, santé et scolarité)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on July 25, 2003. The 15 women who make up this group work in market gardening, sell palm oil, or buy and sell various small items. 

Madame Sounkar, who is on the left in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 49, married, and the mother of two children for whom she is responsible. 

She buys and sells vegetables and palm oil on a small scale. She has been doing this work for several years. This loan will permit her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.  

The profit will allow her to help her husband with the daily expenditures (food, health-related expenses, and school fees).

loans.use: to buy vegetables and palm oil.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rihanata est le responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 09ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de bissighin.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 sachets de mèche,10 sachets de laine et 12 sachets de perle.

Mme économise ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un grand salon de coiffure. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mme Rihanata is the leader of the group WENDTOIN. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest four years old. Two of them go to school. She is also responsible for four other people.
