She has been a hairdresser for nine years. She buys her supplies at the market of Bissighin. Her customers are women. She wants to buy 20 bags of hair extensions, 10 bags of wool, and 12 bags of beads. She is saving up her profit to open a big beauty salon. She dreams of buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of hair extensions, 10 bags of wool, and 12 bags of beads.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 38 años de edad, es padre soltero de 3 hijos y junto a ellos reside en el Barrio El Centro en el municipio de Patuca. El se dedica a la carpinteria, su oficio lo aprendió trabajando como ayudante de su hermano mayor. Doce años atrás inició elaborando sus trabajos solamente con herramientas manuales y luego de un tiempo pudo ahorrar algo de dinero y comenzó a adquirir algunas herramientas electricas para asi agilizar mas su trabajo. Su taller de carpinteria funciona en el patio trasero de su vivienda, y lo atiende él y un familiar, su horario de atencion al cliente comienza desde las 7:30 am y finaliza a las 4:30 pm. El prestamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de madera de caoba. Con el apoyo del prestamo podrá terminar algunos de los trabajos que ya tiene encargados y eso le permitirá seguir teniendo un ingreso para sostener a su familia. Su sueño es llegar a ser el propietario de una muebleria y se esforzara para conseguirlo, tambien seguirá apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio para que sean profesionales y tengan mayores oportunidades de desarrollarse y ganarse la vida. Este es el segundo prestamo de Orlando en Fama y espera cumplir con sus pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Orlando, 38, is a single father of three children and he lives with them in the neighborhood known as El Centro in the town of Patuca.  He is a carpenter by trade and learned the business working alongside his elder brother as an assistant.  He began twelve years ago working only with hand tools and once he had enough money saved he began acquiring electrical equipment to facilitate his work.  His workshop is set up on the patio behind his house and he and another relative work there together.  His is open for business from 7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.  

He plans to use the loan to buy mahogany wood.  With the help of the loan he will be able to finish some of the jobs he has on order and this will give him income for household expenses.  His dream is to be the owner of a large furniture business and he is making every effort to accomplish this.  He also wants to continue supporting his children so they can get an education and become professionals with more opportunities to get ahead in life.  This is Orlando's second loan through Fama and he is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Brima S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, for a loan of 6,300,000 SLL in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and paying SMT.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Brima S. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 36-year-old Brima was born in Kailahun, in eastern Sierra Leone. Brima has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He is married and has two children. Brima has requested this loan in order to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a family house

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Matutuine, Provincia de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, solteiro, masculino vive  maritalmente tem 2 filhas 1 tem 7 anos  frequenta a  segunda classe e a outra tem 3anos de idade.Estão a sua responsabilidade a avó paterna, sua mãe e 2 irmãs mais novas tem residencia em Ka tembe N’sime onde se encontra outra parte da familia.
Neste encontra se a trabalhar na Sede Distrital do Partido Frelimo Matutuine, como Tecnico de organização mobilização  e propaganda, tem salario de 8.300,00mt, com o ganha compra alimentos, paga despesas escolares  pra familia e poupa algum valor.
Nunca teve emprestimos com outros bancos, o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku foi de 8.000,00mt-fabrico de blocos o segundo de 12.000,00mt-compra de material de contrução o terceiro tambem compra de material de contrução local para herguer uma casinha em material precario em Bela-Vista o quarto foi pra compra de cama. O actual emprestimo é de 22.000,00mt para compra de material de construção.
No futuro ele pensa em fazer fomento pecuario na compra de gado bovino para criar, e vai recorer a Hluvuku pra o financiamento.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in Matutuine, Maputo province.  He is 28 years old, unmarried but living with his partner with whom he has 2 daughters.  One is 7 years old and attends school.  The other is 3.  He also supports his paternal grandfather, his mother, and two younger sisters who live in Katembe N'sime, where the rest of his family lives. 

He works in the district headquarters of the Frelimo Matutuine Party, as a public organizing and propaganda professional.  He earns 8.300.00mt which he uses to purchase food, pay for school expenses, for his family, and savings.

He has never had a loan with other banks.  His first loan with Hluvuku was for 8.000,00mt to make cement blocks.  The second was for 12.000,00mt to purchase construction materials.  The third was also to purchase construction materials to build a house of low quality materials in Bela-Vista.  The fourth was for the purchase of a bed.  This loan is for 22.000,00mt and will be used to purchase construction materials.  In the future, Augusto would like to start a cattle business, purchasing and raising cattle.  He will work with Hluvuku for the financing.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement block).

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is 53 years old, and married with 2 daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Vinh earns a living operating a photography shop from the front of his house, which he has done for the past 15 years. His business primarily involves taking photos, developing photos, and selling photo-related items to his customers. Vinh's wife also helps him to manage the shop. 

Vinh would like to take a loan to buy better quality camera equipment and materials for his business (such as printing paper, albums, and a camera). Vinh hopes the loan will help him to provide a better service, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and photography materials (camera, albums, printing paper).

loans.name: Mario Luis

texts.es: Mario es un hombre de 37 años que vive en Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 15 años. Allí tiene un taller de ebanistería, producto de su experiencia cuando fue empleado en una carpintería durante 10 años. Desde hace 5 años indicó su propia aventura de negocio en el marco de su experiencia y fabricando cada una de sus herramientas de trabajo poco a poco, e hizo trueques con muebles de su producción para obtener las más nuevas. En su negocio fabrica juegos de salas, multimuebles, puertas, y cocinas a la comunidad donde vive y en otras, además de tener clientes empresariales quienes le suministran los materiales y el ofrece sus servicios de fabricación. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues desea invertir en materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, como selladores, madera, puntillas, gomas, y una máquina sinfín,  porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para logra su potencial crecimiento; Comprando de contado y en volumen ganaría descuentos y sería más competitivo en la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mario is a 37 year old man who lives in Malambo, in the Barranquilla metro area, with his spouse and two sons of 14 and 15. He has a cabinetmaking workshop there, which came out of his experience working in a carpentry shop for 10 years. For the past 5 years he has run his own business venture, building on his experience, and has made each one of his work tools little by little and bartered his furniture for the newest tools. At his business, he makes living room sets, entertainment centers, doors, and kitchen counters in his own community and in others. He also takes commissions from clients who provide him the materials while he provides the labor. 

This loan is the first financing he's taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner]. He hopes to invest in a more primary materials and inputs, such as wood stains, wood, moulding, glue, and a table saw, as his current stock is insufficient to reach his potential growth. 
Buying periodically and in large quantities would get him discounts and make him more competitive in marketing his products.

loans.use: to invest in a more primary materials, such as wood stains, wood, moulding, glue, and a table saw.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.ru:
Иноятхон умная, добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать деньги, а она сама кормить и обеспечивает своих детей. Она свою торговую точку на местном рынке, там где много народов. Он продает женские ткани, а также шторы. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1475$ США для покупки нового ассортимента тканей и шторы. Она хочет заранее благодарит Киву и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Inoyatkhon is a smart, conscientious and hard-working woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children.  Her husband left to go to Russia in order to earn money, and she supports and provides for her children on her own.  She owns a retail outlet in a well-traveled area of the local market.  Inoyatkhon sells women's fabrics and also drapes.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1475 for the purchase of a new assortment of fabrics and drapes.  She wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and drapes

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mr. Sam, 36 years old, is a villager in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. He is married with three children. All of his children are single and school-age. Mr. Sam has worked as a local cultivator as well as a mortar maker for many years. From mortar making, he typically earns $4.50 USD per day. His wife also assists him in the same occupation. The heavy rainfall is a good sign for him to grow rice crops. Because of lacking financial sources, Mr. Sam is looking for a loan to support his crop-planting business.  He will use it to purchase insecticides and to hire local laborers to help him during the  harvest process. Mr. Sam said that in the future, he’ll be able to enlarge his mortar-making business to satisfy his customers’ needs and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and to hire local laborers to help him in harvest process.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child.  She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual invirtió en comprar de cierta mercancía para la venta. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía que es (material para construcciones y accesorios para el baños) ya que le esta haciendo falta esta mercancía a su negocio y nos quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Desea mejorar la inversión de su negocio y la calidad de vida y la seguridad de su familia. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio planea pagar el crédito y que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Ismael is grateful for your cooperation with his previous loan, which he invested in purchasing some merchandise for sale.  

He is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise (construction materials and bathroom accessories) which his business currently lacks, and he wants us to decapitalize his business.

He wants to improve investment in his business and into his quality of life and family security.

With part of the earning he will get from his business' sales, he plans to pay back the loan.  His sales are his source of income for his family

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for his hardware business.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr: LA PAIX est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Appoline Verène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Appoline Verène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Appoline Verène a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a près de six ans que Appoline Verène vend des produits divers (liqueurs, savons, biscuits)  dans son quartier. Appoline Verène exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Appoline Verène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Appoline Verène sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe LA PAIX . Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
LA PAIX is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Appoline Verène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a mechanic by the name of Jean. They have four children, all in school. Two of the children are in their care. She and her husband live together and jointly cover the different expenses of the children. 

Appoline Verène dropped out of elementary school. For six years, she has been selling a variety of goods (liquors, soaps, cookies) in her district. She works at it passionately, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and with the aim of increase her working capital, Appoline Verène along with the other members of the group LA PAIX are requesting a third loan. This loan will serve them in responding better to the demands of their customers and in making more profit.

loans.use: to buy various items (liquors, soaps, cookies)

loans.name: Abigumira

texts.en:
Abigumira, age 40, lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He and his wife have four children who are all currently enrolled in school. For the past three years, Abigumira has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Abigumira has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, sugar, and cooking oil to offer for sale, and the expected profits will help Abigumira to improve his business and pay school fees for his children. Abigumira hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Abigumira is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abigumira who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, and cooking oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a 37 year old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the agricultural sector for six years. His major challenge is seasonal weather and his dreams are educating his children plus constructing houses for renting. Vicent needs the loan to pay workers who are weeding his Irish potatoe and maize garden.

loans.use: to weed his irish potatoe and maize garden.

loans.name: Davlatpochoh

texts.ru: Давлатпочох замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она занимается шитьем национальных и европейских женских платьев. Имеет большой опыт в своем работе, так как она более 15 лет занималась этим. Давлатпочох имеет много клиентов, которые заказывает ей и доверяет в её рук дело. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку для того чтобы шить более качественно с новыми технологиями. Она надеется на вашу помощь и признательно вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davlatpochoh is married and is a mother of two children.  She is involved in sewing national and European women's dresses.  She has an extensive experience in this business since she has been involved in it for over 15 years.  Davlatpochoh has many clients, who order from her and trust her with their orders.  She wants to purchase a new sewing machine in order to use new technologies to sew with better quality.  She hopes to get your help and is grateful to you for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is a 28-year-old a married woman with no children. She's had a business of selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amour requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda, 45, is married to Monica and they are blessed with three children. He sells ice cream and also owns rental houses that have given him a monthly income of KES 15,000 for the last seven years.

This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loans. He will use the funds to install electricity in the rental houses. He hopes to build more rentals in future.

loans.use: to install electricity in his rental houses

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 48 años, convive con Efraín de 32 años y tienen 05. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en la comunidad de Camunachari. Simona, es campesina  sus padres le enseñaron éste oficio desde muy niña, desde entonces ha ejercido esta actividad durante 20 años, cultivando y criando animales. En tiempos de festividades, los animales que posee como gallinas, cerdos, son vendidos rápidamente, pues la crianza y alimentación que les da, supera a la competencia y por ello tiene buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comprar sus animales desde muy pequeños y luego verlas grandes y robustos con el tiempo. Considera que lo más difícil es cuando las enfermedades que ocasionan a los animales puede ser muy riesgoso para los demás. En adelante, espera comprar nuevos animales, para aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará nuevos animales, para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Simona is 48 years old and lives with Efraín, who is 32 years old.  They live, together with their five children, in their own home in the community of Camunachari.  Simona is a farmer, whose parents taught her this trade when she was a very young girl.  She has been farming and raising animals for 20 years since then.  In times of the festivities, she has hens and pigs that sell quickly, due to the good breeding and diet that she provides them.  She surpasses the competition and, for this reason, she has good profits.  What she likes most about her job is buying her animals when they are very young and then watching them grow large and robust with time.  What she considers the most difficult is when the animals contract diseases as this may place the others at risk.  In the future, she hopes to buy new animals in order to increase production.  This will be her second loan with MFP; she feels that the money from the loan will help a lot with the progress of her business.  She is very dear to the rest of her companions in the communal bank and shares a bond of solidarity with them. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will purchase new animals in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as hens and pigs.

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en: Elkana is 26 years old and married with 3 children. He distributes water to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in the slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to grow his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Glenda Yosmary

texts.es:
La joven Glenda tiene 32 años, vive en la zona sur del país, junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos y su madre quien la respalda en sus actividades, como también en cada uno de sus responsabilidades. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estrategia, donde la fluidez de persona es en grandes cantidades ya que esta a orilla de calle, y esto hace que sea muy visitado. Glenda el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, cal, leña, harina, leche, manteca, levadura, azúcar etc. el impacto que espera con el crédito, es contrarrestar la demanda de producto que le hace sus clientes, como también generarse mejores ingresos para el crecimiento de su negocio, y con esto darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los planes a futuro de Glenda es crecer día a día en su actividad, y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, harina, leche, manteca, levadura, azúcar etc. para su negocio

loans.name: Paquecaquisis Group

texts.es:
El señor Lucas está soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, curso 2 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio de ropa de toda clase para todas las edades, inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia y le ha resultado este negocio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un  préstamo que lo utilizara para a compra de mercadería y poder así tener más variedad de producto que ofrecer, espera en el futuro tener un capital más amplio y un negocio bien posicionado  en el mercado. Los demás integrantes se dedica al comercio. Una de las que estan en la foto no califico para el credito.

loans.use: Comprar mercadería

loans.name: Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QOLQUEWASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agustina ella es casada soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the 'Qolquewasi' community bank. This bank is located in the Cusco District, in Cusco province and Cusco department.

The borrower is Agustina. She is 54 years old, married/single and has a son. She works at her grocery store business and also selling 'truchas'. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has now been working in this business for eight years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members' businesses are selling snacks, selling clothing, a grocery store and a book store.

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and she promises to make her payment installments within the time period allowed.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca started her business with a remittance she received from a family member in Italy. She sells cosmetics and jewelry to the people in her community. She often must sell her products on credit and she collects payments weekly. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for the upcoming holiday season when sales are higher.

This activity helps her provide for her young children who are still going to school. The biggest difficulty she has had is providing them with an education and adequate housing. She still lives in a house made of wood and her main goal is to make cement improvements.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy jewelery and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Development and sale of quality food

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Vincent K. is 43 years old. He has four wives and thirteen children to care for. The wives all work alongside him in the fields, but without enough land the family has difficulty meeting it's needs, especially the cost of educating the children, so sadly, they live in poverty. In order to expand his arable land Vincent is seeking a loan of $700. He is a hard-working, dovoted and honest man who repaid his one previous loan promptly. This, his second loan, will help him improve his family's standard of living and provide for the children's education so they can get ahead in life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur K. Vincent a quatre (04) femmes et treize (13) enfants à charge. Toutes les femmes l’aident dans les travaux champêtres. La superficie cultivable n’étant pas grande ne permet pas à Monsieur K. de satisfaire les besoins de la famille surtout la scolarisation de tous les enfants. Cette situation plonge la famille dans une misère totale. Pour remédier à cette situation, il a voulu augmenter la superficie de son espace cultivable. Faute de moyen, il sollicite un crédit de $700. Actif, dévoué et honnête, il avait reçu un premier qu’il a remboursé dans les meilleurs délais. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et bien s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants afin de les voir un jour devenir des grands cadres.

loans.use: To expand his arable land.

loans.name: Talialofa

texts.en: Talialofa is a fifty seven year old lady with four children. She believes that a barbecue stand is the fastest way to earn money even though it requires more work before it can sell. But that doesn’t matter to her because she needs money to satisfy her family needs, especially to support her kids' education. She has applied for a $300 loan and will use it to buy all the ingredients needed for the barbecue business, especially meats. She is planning to get another loan to make her business bigger, maintain the good service she put in her business and get a hold on her usual customers. She is very excited for her business and appreciates the help she gets from Kiva.

loans.use: Buying ingredients needed for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more ingredients to increase his production

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sopheab (aged 29) got married in 2002 and has one daughter. She runs a business weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1990 and began her silk production in the same year. She has trained her husband to weave as well. Her husband, Mr. Chun Chin, also fishes for a living. As they both did not complete primary school, they are committed to seeing that their daughter completes her higher education. She currently attends the kindergarten school in their village.

Mrs P. has borrowed money from MAXIMA thrice. She is now requesting a $200 loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, pay fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a widow with two children. She runs a small pharmacy in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. She started her business in 1997 after the death of her husband. She started by selling basic medicines in a small quantity in her neighbourhood and has now expanded her business.

Being a single mother and solely responsible for providing for her family's expenses, Mary took several loans from SMT to expand her business to earn better profit. Mary now intends to expand her business to another location in Makeni called Masimra where the demand for medicines is high. She is therefore requesting a $1,200 loan to undertake this expansion.

loans.use: Expand her pharmacy to another area of Makeni town where demand is high.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more equipment. Sarah is 28 years old and single. She has 1 child age 6, who goes to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to enable business expansion and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Veronica O., Lydia N., Esther K., and Monica A.. Veronica O. is currently in the business of running a grocery and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to expand her business.

Lydia N. is currently in the business of operating a saloon and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy more saloon equipment.

Esther K. is currently in the business of selling fruit and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to invest more in her business.

Monica A. is currently in the business running a saloon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more equipment

loans.name: Hadeesa's Group

texts.en:
I am Hadeesa B. from Arifwala, a small town in Pakistan. I am the mother of two kids who are small and do not attend school currently but will hopefully attend school in the near future. I am borrowing for the second time from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan.

My husband works at a transport company and wants to buy a rickshaw. He will give this rickshaw for rent to his brother. This way both will mutually benefit from the profits.

I would like to borrow in a group that includes: Shazia B., who will use the loan to expand her vegetable shop; Shabana B., who intends to use her share of loan to expand her vegetable and legume business; and Fatima B., who needs this loan for her family’s mobile phone store.

As this is a group loan we mutually accept responsibility of this loan.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and expand family businesses

loans.name: Ceberiana

texts.es:
Ceberiana has operated her general store for more than 20 years. Starting 6 years ago, she began to apply for loans that have allowed her wood and laminate "estanquilla" (hut or stand with a counter for selling food) to be rebuilt with cement block and concrete. She's also expanded her house and bought a food cart because, along with the general store, she started selling flour tortillas and tacos. Her two daughters and her husband help her tend the business and even though her grandchildren are still very young, they occasionally help out, as well.

She now needs a loan for US$750, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy a food cart and put it outside of her store so that she can sell food there. With your help, Celebriana can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ceberiana tiene mas de 20 años con su miscelánea, pero desde hace 6 años principió a tramitar créditos que le han permitido que su estanquillo de madera y lamina lo fuera construyendo de block, y cemento, además su casa la amplio, y ahora adquirió un puesto rodante, porque además de la miscelánea empezó a vender tortillas de harina y taquitos mañaneros. Sus dos hijas y su esposo le ayudan a atender el negocio, y como sus nietos ya son jovencitos, ocasionalmente también le ayudan.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un carrito y colocarlo afuera de su tienda y así vender la comida ahí. Con tu ayuda Ceberiana podrá seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Buy a food cart.

loans.name: Rachael Agwa

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Ma Rachael is married to a polygamist, Chief Foguh. They are blessed with six children, three of whom are under the age of fifteen years. The fact that she was unable to acquire a basic education has made life very difficult for Ma Rachael. She also struggled in the past with the frustration of being unable to help her husband provide for their family. Worst of all, she could not give her children three square meals a day or pay for schools fees.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE in 2002 by a friend who is also a GHAPE member. Since then, she has taken out four loans and repaid them on time. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children’s school fees and meet some of her family’s basic needs, like food.

Given this loan, she plans to buy goats, cassava (a starchy root that is a staple in Cameroon), and seedlings. Ma Rachael has been growing crops such as cassava and preparing garri for resale. With her new investments, she will be able to breed and raise goats and expand her farm. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and managing a business from GHAPE.

Ma Rachael plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of goats, cassava, and seedlings

loans.name: Kimly Chay Group

texts.en: Five people in Sala Lek Pram village will be forming a group. Mrs. Kimly C. is the group leader. She sells clothes in the local market. Her business activity improved largely lately, so she would like to expand her business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Kimly C. does not have enough money to buy more new fashion clothes for her customers.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Kimly C. is 55 and the mother of two children, one of whom owns a small restaurant where breakfast is sold to the villagers. The other one is a cake maker and seller. Her husband, Mr. Sun E., is unemployed and he usually assists his wife in the market.

loans.use: Buy more new fashion clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N. sells rice as well as fried rice with pork and chicken at a school. She has three children, all of whom are living in the family home with her. Two of her children are studying in University and are near graduation. Because of the difficulty of commuting to school for class and study sessions, N. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children go to school. The loan will allow the family to reduce their transportation expenses and reduce the commute time to work and school.

The picture is one of N.'s sons.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children go to school

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
I am Gilberto Treviño Córdova. I work as an employee of a company in Piedras Negras, but my salary is not enough to pay all living expenses. I have three small children, and two of them are already of schooling age. To support the children, my wife helped me with a small grocery store that we have in the house, but we could not make it work for a lack of resources. Therefore, we are asking for the amount of $225 to supply our grocery store to make it more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo soy Gilberto Treviño Córdova, yo trabajo como empleado en una empresa de Piedras Negras, pero mi sueldo no es suficiente para pagar todos los gasto de la casa y de mis tres pequeños hijos dos de ellos ya están en edad escolar, así que para esto mi esposa me ayuda con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que tenemos en la casa pero no hemos podido hacerla funcionar por falta de recursos así que pedimos la cantidad de 225 dls para poder surtir nuestra tiendita y hacerla productiva.

loans.use: To supply his grocery store

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea C., 23, and her husband, Mr. Mab C., 28, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have one daughter.

Mrs. Sophea has been a silk weaver for five years, using a skill she learned from her neighbor. Mr. Mab has been a silk weaver for seven years. He learned his skill from his sister. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sophea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her husband's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira R., from the village of Bečići near Banovići, was born in 1947 and is married to a retailer. Sabira works a great deal in her garden and field, producing healthy food both for sale and for home consumption. Her husband helps her mostly with their cows. She earns about $225 monthly from selling milk and milk products.

Sabira is very entrepreneurial and wants to extend her business by buying poultry. She has already received loans from WWI and now is requesting a loan in the amount of $450. Through this loan she hopes to be able to offer the best quality of poultry meat.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mrs.chhoen Chan Thy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank borrowing group consists of sixteen members and is located in Oknha Pang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The group members will use their shares of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chhoen C. T. is the village bank president and she owns a small place where she sells Khmer noodles to villagers and passers-by. She is a 40-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Chhoen C. T. and her children have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Chhoen C. T. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for her household to live in better conditions.

Mrs. Ouern P. did not come to the loan group meeting but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to add to her savings to build a new house

loans.name: Saudatu

texts.en: Saudatu A. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Saudatu sells a local porridge and doughnuts in the morning to those on their way to work in Kokompe near Shama, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a commercial driver. Saudatu uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Saudatu will use the loan to purchase more wheat, sugar and other ingredients for the food preparation. With the new profits from her expanded business, Saudatu plans to support in her children's education. At the time this picture was taken, her porridge had been sold and she had already packed her things and was about to leave.

loans.use: Saudatu will use the loan to purchase more wheat, sugar and other ingredients for the food preparation.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget knits cardigans and sells them wholesale and retail. She started her business in 2006. She is 28 years old and single. She needs a loan amount of N70,000 ($600) to purchase additional materials to knit more cardigans to sell. She is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase materials for knitting cardigans to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Soy Prok  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Bér village in KampO. Chhnang province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Chan Soy P. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup as a breakfast food to the villagers. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, but she does not have rice seed. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Chan Soy P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. 

Ten members in this group loans will receive End-of-Term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed.

loans.name: Mbagye

texts.en:
C. is a single mother with four children; she lives in Mile 19 Mbengwi, just outside of Bamenda (about one hour drive during the dry season), in Cameroon. Being the bread winner of her home, C. has been a very hard working woman her whole life just to sustain herself and her children (one son suffers from sickle cell). With this loan, C. plans to invest in her buyam–sellam business, piggery and farming. More specifically, she will purchase egusi (a type of seed), palm oil, piglets and crop seeds.  
 
This is C.'s second loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2005.  She has a great deal of experience in her buyam–sellam business. Over the years, her customers have become regular as they build a trusting relationship and use her catering services for social gatherings. She also feels that she has an excellent site for her business. 
 
The profit from this loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. She will also invest most of her profits into her business. The rest will be used to clothe her children well, provide medical assistance to her family, and feed her family.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and the community.

loans.use: To buy egusi, palm oil, piglets, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 42 años, tiene casa propia donde habita junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.  Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar, pues se dedica a múltiples actividades, pero la más importante es la venta de bebidas y comida que realiza en la puerta del mercado desde  hace 2 años, gracias a una oportunidad que le brindaron instaló su puesto y tiene grandes ganancias, ya que está ubicada en una zona muy transitada. Ahora, por temporada de verano las personas concurren con más frecuencia a los mercados, pero para estar a las horas de mayor concurrencia Lucila tiene que preparar desde temprano los refrescos y la comida para  instalarse en su puesto y comenzar a vender hasta el medio día, para luego retornar  a su hogar muy cansada pero contenta por la labor realizada. Ahora tiene proyectado abrir un pequeño, de venta de jugos para así no tener que  trasladar sus cosas de un lugar a otro y brindar tranquilidad y los servicios necesarios a sus clientes. Lucila viene trabajando con MFP desde hace 6 años, ella está muy contenta de formar parte de un grupo tan bonito dentro de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que requiere instalará un puesto de jugos en el mercado y así hacer menor su carga laboral.
texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old, has her own home where she lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a woman with great desires to succeed, so she holds various jobs but the most important is selling beverages and food at the entrance of the market, something she has done for 2 years. Thanks to an opportunity that they provided her she installed her stand and has large earnings, as she is located in a very highly frequented area. Now, in the summer, people are going to the market more frequently, but to be there the greatest number of hours Lucila has to prepare her refreshments and food early in order to be in her stand and start selling at midday, to then return home very tired but content because of the work she has completed. Now she pans on opening a small juice stand so she doesn’t have to move the items in her home from one place to another and provide tranquility and necessary services to her customers. Lucila has been working with MFP for 6 years, she is very content to be part of such a beautiful group within her communal bank. With the money that she needs she will open a juice stand in the market to make her work easier.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a juice stand

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. He is a reliable client who has not had any loan repayment delays. Iskandar is 29 years old and he is married. Iskandar has achieved higher education but he does not work as a school teacher because the teacher salary is too low.

Iskandar trades in school accessories, stationery and books. He brings the assortment from Istaravshan and he has engaged in this business for 2 years. As he is an educated young man, he can recommend the required books, and he has repeat customers.

Iskandar wants to go to China and get a large scale stationery order. He applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 800 STJ for 5 months to get the required documents and to go to China. He thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To get the required documents and to go to China

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
These three borrowers have jointed together to get a loan, and Mrs. S. leads the group. S. is a local food seller. She sells to seamstresses who work in garment factories. She makes about $3 per day to feed her family. She is married to VeaSna, 29, who earns a living as a garment worker. The couple is very responsible and their three children are school age. Now S. needs to satisfy more customers by seeking a loan from HKL to increase her business capital.

The other borrowers are: L., a food seller is looking for a loan to expand her business operations. S. is a domestic hairdresser requesting a loan to order hairdressing materials. They all live in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: Increase business capital.

loans.name: Legogo

texts.en: Legogo E., 21, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village and public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 390 Tala (about US $123).  SPBD loans are Legogo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She use her loan for home improvement and school needs.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
For N. Christine, joining her lending group of Gakuweebwa munno is the wisest thing she has ever done for her family and business. The reason being, she has been able to expand the stock of her new clothes, her children are attending good schools plus she is able to buy more household items hence improving the standard of living for herself and family.

Christine is 31 years old and married with five children aged 18 – 7 months. She also cares for an orphan in primary school. She sells her clothes from various locations and her dream is to build her own shop and trade from there. She needs a loan to help buy more stock for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her stock

loans.name: Lorly

texts.en:
Lorly L. owns and operates a sari-sari (general store), selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. Lorly has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lorly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lorly has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lorly is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita Q. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Marianita is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Marianita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells snacks and other food products within Sto. Nino School, in Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marianita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the  business (habal-habal). She does have a motorcycle, locally known as habal – habal, for transport within their place. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marianita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand inventory.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through tertiary education. Bernice sells a variety of assorted provisions in Central market, Kpando, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader. Bernice uses her income for payment of the children's school fees and all the financial needs of the children. Bernice will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven J., from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 55 years old and the married father of four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcab business that offers transportation to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, Joven earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2001, Joven joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC, he is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joven from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hog raiser.  Her desire to assist her husband in providing the daily needs of their family and in supporting the educational needs of their children motivates her to work hard.  She is married to Felix Jr. and they are blessed with four children, all studying.  Two are in college, one is in high school and the youngest is in kindergarten.  She is already 39 years old and is doing her best to become a responsible wife and mother to her children. She is also thankful for blessing her with a good and loving husband who supports her all the time. 

Nelia wants to develop her piggery business, thus requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP4,000. She hopes that with that amount, she will be able to buy additional piglets and a sack of feed. She is hoping that someday, the pigs she is raising will double in number and she will have a stable business with the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Aita Sene

texts.fr: aita sene W. est parent beneficiaire vendeuse de poissons capitalisant une experience de plus de six ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter  son fond et gagner d'autres marches.son objectif est de mieux assister sa famille a ameliorer le cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Aita Sene W. is a recipient parent and a fish seller capitalizing on over six years of experience in her business.  She's requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her capital and to reach other markets.  Her goal is to assist her family further in improving its living conditions.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund D. is from the village of Banawan, Iligan city. He is 29 years old. Raymund is single. To make a living, Raymund owns & operates a service-based business. Raymund is just starting this taxi services business.

In 2009, Raymund joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Raymund is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Raymund from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum N., age 36 and his wife, Mrs. Thida Khoun, age 37, have been married since 1994 and have three daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.   
 
Chhum has been selling Phaklov (meal that cook with port) in his village for 7 years. His wife is a hairdresser. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a cart to carry Phaklov for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to carry Phaklov (meal that cook with pork) for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Yubania

texts.es: La señora Yubania A. de 36 años de edad, se dedica al lavado y planchado desde hace siete años es la forma de estar en su casa y pode cuidar a su hija de 10 años de  edad la cual va a clase, su esposo es mariachi el cual sale por las noche en la rotonda de Bello Horizonte una zona de la capital en donde están los músicos que alegran a los Managuas, sus planes es mejorar su vivienda hacerle las mejoras para darle a su familia seguridad, ella vive en un barrio llamado Laureles Norte, lleva cuatro ciclo en la institución y muy sastifecha por los logros, con este crédito repara su cerco y hará un pequeño muro para mejor seguridad de su vivienda. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos que han sido en gran beneficio.
texts.en:
Yubania A. is 36. She has been working at washing and ironing for seven years. It is a way of being at home and being able to take care of her ten year old daughter. Her daughter goes to school. Her husband is a mariachi. At night he goes to the Bello Horizonte rotunda in the capital. That is where all the musicians who make the Managuans happy are. Her plan is to improve her home by making some improvements to give her family security. She lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte. She is in her fourth cycle with the institution. She is very satisfied with the achievements. She will use this loan to fix a fence and build a small wall for better security for her home. She is grateful to Afodenic for the help with the loans, which have been of great benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a small wall

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with three children. He lives in Isfara and sells spare parts and lubricants. His small facility is favorably located in his countryside is Isfara town. His business is very promising and flourishing. Safokhudja has an individual approach to each of his customers, which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 13 years. Today he needs a loan of $1500 USD for increasing his inventory. Safokhudja is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for car in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Favor

texts.en: Favor is married with three children. Her eldest child is 12 years old and the youngest child is six years old. She is 34 years old. Her husband is a pastor.  She sells groceries and drinks in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel C. is from the village of Ibung, Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Rodel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Rodel has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rodel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rodel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Isela C. se ha dedicado a laborar mucho para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y para mantener a su familia que depende de ella. 

Actualmente, la señora Isela busca la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y lo más ideal y que tiene la necesidad es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello solicita el crédito para dar lugar a la reconstrucción en especial, la localidad donde tiene su cocina ya que no está en buenas condiciones por lo que decidió iniciar esta obra para sentirse muy satisfecha con este logro y lograr que sus hijos se sientan alegres.
texts.en:
Isela C. lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur. She has always worked very hard to bring sustenance to her home and to support her family that depend on her. Currently, she would like to improve her children's quality of life and the most ideal way of doing this is to make improvements on her dwelling. She is requesting financing to bring about these improvements, especially in the kitchen which is not in very good condition. This is why she decided to start this project so that she can feel satisfied with her achievement and see that her children feel cheerful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mana está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y muy competentes que desde muy tempranas horas están realizando sus labores. Ellas son Karla B. Flores quien comenzó vendiendo refresco y luego se introdujo a comercializar  productos de la marca Avon y zapatos, Susana María A. vende tortillas y frijoles, Nelly Socorro Palacio B. tiene una pulpería  y Estela Z. S. comercializa jocotes y pinolillo.

Ellas esperan el próximo año seguir trabajando y progresar para ello invertirán este presta y su dedicación a sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Mana" is formed by 4 hardworking and competent women who rise early to begin their work. They are: Karla B. Flores, who sells drinks and markets Avon brand products and shoes; Susana Maria A., who sells tortillas and beans; Nelly Socorro Palacio B., who has a small grocery store; and Estela Z. Sanchez, who sells plums and pinolillo (a typical Nicaraguan drink made of roasted corn flour and cocoa.) They expect that next year they will continue to work and progress, to accomplish this they will invest this loan and dedicate themselves to their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Saimuhammad

texts.en: T. Saimuhammad is 26 years old. He is a market vendor. He sells men’s shoes and clothing at the market. With over a year of working at the market, Saimuhammad already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Saimuhammad is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Today he is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. For this purpose, he requests $2,700. Saimuhammad promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Be an important part of the growth of Saimuhammad’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khiev, 39, (pictured together) were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
	
Vanna is a farmer and grows jasmine flowers on her farmland. Besides farming, she also sells jasmine flowers at the market in Phnom Penh. Some she buys from farmers in the village for resale, some are from her own farm. Her husband has been a construction worker for eighteen years, working in the village.

Vanna is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$1,100 to purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract. She needs to pay money to the farmers first before the harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers from farmers under contract

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis Angel A. M., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. Tiene dos hijos uno de 33 y otro de 27 años.El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para sembrar los tubérculos, específicamente ñampí, la idea es además de preparar el terreno, es comprar cal y otros insumos para poder realizar la siembra. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a las 5 hecctéras del cultivo y lograr una mejor calidad, para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis Angel  trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis Angel A. M. is 55 years old, is married and lives with his wife. He has 2 children, 33 and 27 years old. He wants this loan to prepare his land to sow tubers, particularly ñampí. The idea is, apart from preparing the land, to also buy lime and other products to complete the sowing. Luis wants to give adequate maintenance to his 5 hectares of crops and achieve a better quality of crop to obtain the best earnings possible when it is time to harvest. This is the first time he has sought a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very content with the facilities that they have granted. Don Luis Angel has worked in agriculture for many years. His hope for the future is to give his family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: www.FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sowing tubers

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and two brothers. He has owned a car-body repair shop in his village since 2007 having learned this occupation from a friend. With his business income, he provides, along with his father and brothers, for the living expenses of the family.

Since its start, Halim’s business operation has grown. Thus he wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy additionA. new tools to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy an additional new tools

loans.name: Cité De La Gloire Plus Group

texts.en:
Huguettes’s main business is selling vegetables in a market to the west of Kinshasa. She earns $480 per month. Since 1994, she has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day becoming a vegetable provider in her community. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

Huguettes is a trustworthy client of the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying vegetables and reselling them at a profit.

Huguettes is the director of the group “Cité de la Gloire Plus” made up of 26 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old father of four. He runs a retail shop and offers telephone services in his shop. He has been in this business for 10 years. He also runs a video production and a photography studio to earn extra income.  He previously took out seven loans from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.   He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 90,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy mobile phone calling cards and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and calling cards

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. prepares 'Fante kenkey' (a staple maize dish) for sale and distribution at Abura.  Ama has received junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband works in a soap-making factory. 

Ama has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for some time now. She helps her husband in taking good care of themselves and the children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save if possible to operate a 'kenkey' factory where she would produce and distribute to customers.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Elizabeth Akoth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Akoth O. owns a stationery store in Rongo town. Before starting this business in 2002, Elizabeth use to sell second hand clothes. She says the income from second hand clothing sales was not sufficient compared to her new profitable stationery business. She buys her stock in Nairobi every six weeks.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and blessed with seven (7) children, whom she wants to educate to the highest level. To do this, she decided to join KMET microfinance program. She wishes to get a loan worth KES50,000 to increase her stock and ensure an increase in income.

Her future dream is to expand her business by building and owning rental housing. This would see her become financially independent.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De Los Ángeles tiene 40 años, tiene 3 hijos que todavía están bajo su cargo. Empezó a ser comerciante desde muy joven ya que toda su familia es comerciante ella también quiso ser igual y tener sus propios ingresos. Invirtió en ciertos productos como ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otras cosas, siempre le ha gustado ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio y esto le ha ayudado en su vida personal. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos varios, por lo que ya tiene algunos pedidos. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jeanette De Los Ángeles is 40 years old and has three dependent children.
